types.name: Query
types.description: Root fields to access the Twitch API.

fields.name: allTags
fields.description: Get all tags.

fields.name: automodContent
fields.description: Get AutoMod evaluation of text using AutoMod rule.

fields.name: badges
fields.description: A list of global chat badges.

fields.name: bitsOffers
fields.description: Gets a list of Bits offers for a logged out user, for use on the Bits landing page.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: Get a channel by ID or name.

fields.name: channels
fields.description: Get a list of channels, either by IDs or by their names.

fields.name: chatRoomBanStatus
fields.description: Get the ban status of a usser with respect to a channel's chat room.

fields.name: clip
fields.description: Get a clip by slug.

fields.name: collection
fields.description: Get a single collection (playlist) item by its ID.

fields.name: community
fields.description:
Get a single community by its ID or name
Will error if both id and name are supplied.

fields.name: contentTag
fields.description: Get a content tag by tag ID.

fields.name: currentUser
fields.description:
The currently authenticated user.
Returns null if the user is not authenticated.

fields.name: deprecatedEvent
fields.description: Get an Event by ID.
fields.deprecationReason: Migratory field that clients who want to use the deprecated version of events can consume

fields.name: directories
fields.description:
Fetch directories in specified sort order, optionally filtered to the specified type.
Filters are additive, meaning that using two filters will include results from both types.
An empty filter list implies that no filters are applied, hence all results are included regardless of type.
By default returns 10, sorted by descending total viewer count, unfiltered.

fields.name: directory
fields.description: Fetch a single directory by name and type.

fields.name: emote
fields.description: Get an emote by ID.

fields.name: event
fields.description: Get an Event by ID.

fields.name: eventBroadcast
fields.description: Get an EventBraodcast by ID.

fields.name: extension
fields.description:
Get an Extension by ID. Optionally, provide a specific version. If no version is provided,
the released version of that extension is returned.

fields.name: extensionCarousel
fields.description: Get an ExtensionCarousel by ID. The default carousel can be loaded by providing the ID: "default".

fields.name: extensionCategories
fields.description:
Fetch a paginated list of Extension Categories. Each Category will provide the first ten
extensions sorted by popularity in that category.

fields.name: extensionCategory
fields.description: Fetch a single category. Both slugs and ids are valid inputs for getting a category.

fields.name: extensions
fields.description:
Search extensions by text found in the Extension name, description or summary. The results are
always returned in order of popularity. By default, all RELEASED and IN_TEST extensions are returned.
Pass RELEASED as the value of 'state' to only return extensions in the RELEASED state.

fields.name: featuredContentSections
fields.description:
Fetch the sections & content that should be featured on mobile
`language` is a letter code for the language the requesting user speaks (e.g. "en").

fields.name: featuredStreams
fields.description:
Fetch streams that are featured on the front page, ordered by featurePriority ascending.
DEPRECATED: `geolocation` is computed based on GeoIP with a fallback value of "US" and should be omitted
`language` is a letter code for the language the requesting user speaks (ex. "en")
By default returns 6 streams.

fields.name: featuredVideos
fields.description:
Fetch VODs that should be featured on the homepage
`language` is a letter code for the language the requesting user speaks (e.g. "en").

fields.name: feed
fields.description: Get a Feed by ID.

fields.name: feedEmbed
fields.description: Convert a URL to an object that can be embedded into Twitch feeds.

fields.name: feedItemContent
fields.description: Get a feed item by ID.

fields.name: game
fields.description: Get a single game as identified by its name.

fields.name: games
fields.description:
Fetch games in order of descending popularity.
By default returns 10.
Tags are an array of ID as optional filters for games.

fields.name: isUsernameAvailable
fields.description: Get whether a username is available for registration.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Get key code information given a key code.

fields.name: merchandise
fields.description: Get a list of all Twitch Merch products.

fields.name: primeOffers
fields.description:
Get Current PrimeOffers for a given region based on country code (request info or query param)
optional dateOverride to provide offers that would be displayed on that date
optional countryCode to provide offers that are displayed for that country
optional locale to provide offers displayed for the supplied locale.

fields.name: primePromotions
fields.description:
PrimePromotions data - query supports optional identifiers for promotion strings but default behavior will use
countryCode and userID to find available marketing promotions. For whitelisted QA users dateOverride can be provided.

fields.name: rejectedChatMessage
fields.description: Get a message rejected by chat.

fields.name: reportReasons
fields.description: Get a list of valid reasons for a content type.

fields.name: requestInfo
fields.description: Metadata about the request to the API.

fields.name: rewardedVideoProperties
fields.description: RewardedVideoProps returns whether user is in whitelisted mobile bits country.

fields.name: room
fields.description: Get a room by its ID.

fields.name: search
fields.description: Get search results for a user's query.

fields.name: shelves
fields.description: Fetch shelves to display on the homepage.

fields.name: squadStream
fields.description: Get a squad stream by ID.

fields.name: streams
fields.description:
Fetch live streams, ordered by the number of viewers descending.
languages can be empty or null, which will imply all the languages are included on the results.
tags are an array of tag ID as optional filters for streams.
DEPRECATED field arguments: platformType, languageTags, tags
Use StreamOptions instead.

fields.name: subscriptionProduct
fields.description:
Get a subscription product by its name. See product name examples below. The productName uniquely identifies a product.

e.g. "meclipse", "meclipse_2000", "meclipse_3000", these are respectively, the tier 1, 2, and 3 subscription product
names for the user with login "shroud".

fields.name: team
fields.description: Gets a team by its Twitch name.

fields.name: topTags
fields.description: Gets a list of sorted top tags aggregated from all tags applied to current live channels.

fields.name: user
fields.description:
Get a user by their ID or login.
If no ID or login is provided, null is returned.
Lookup type can tell the resolver to include all users (inclusing deleted and
suspended accounts) on the lookup, defaults to only retrieve active users.

fields.name: users
fields.description: Get a list of users, either by their logins or by their IDs.

fields.name: verificationRequest
fields.description:
Get a verification request given an opaqueID.
These are generally email verification requests, but could be phone-numbers in the future.

fields.name: video
fields.description:
Get a video by its ID.
By default, Video queries only return public videos.
If the owner should also see their own private videos, set includePrivate flag in the `options` input.
This flag does not include other people's private videos.

fields.name: videoComments
fields.description: A paginated list of comments against id, videoID, or channelID.

fields.name: videos
fields.description: Get a list of videos in order of descending popularity.

fields.name: whisperThread
fields.description: Get a whisper thread by ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Cursor
types.description:
An opaque identifier for a connection edge. Used for pagination.

This is part of the Relay Cursor Connections Specification:
https://facebook.github.io/relay/graphql/connections.htm.

types.name: TagScope
types.description: An enumeration on the different scope of a tag.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: Tags that can be applied to all content types.

enumValues.name: CATEGORY
enumValues.description: Tags that can only be applied to the CATEGORY content type.

types.name: TagConnection
types.description: A paginated list of tags, and its metadata.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: The list of tags in this page.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information about this page of tags.

types.name: TagEdge
types.description: An element in a paginated tags, and its metadata.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Cursor represents the position of the current edge/node.

fields.name: node
fields.description: Node represents the extension for the current edge.

types.name: Tag
types.description: Tag(s) are used as a discovery and search mechanism for tagged content, including Streams, Clips, and VODs.

fields.name: id
fields.description: This tag's unique identifier.

fields.name: isAutomated
fields.description: Whether this tag is auto generated.

fields.name: isLanguageTag
fields.description: Whether this tag is a language tag.

fields.name: localizedDescription
fields.description: Localized description of this tag.

fields.name: localizedName
fields.description: Localized Name of this tag.

fields.name: tagName
fields.description: Official Name of this tag in English.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description:
PageInfo is a special field which contains information about the page,
specifically the cursors which the page starts and ends, and whether or
not the client can forward-paginate or backward-paginate.

This is part of the Relay Cursor Connections Specification:
https://facebook.github.io/relay/graphql/connections.htm.

types.name: AutomodContentResponse
types.description: AutomodContentResponse is the automod response for the text evaulated.

fields.name: content
fields.description: content are pieces of the content evaulated by automod.

fields.name: text
fields.description: text is the original raw string evaluated by automod.

types.name: RoomMessageContent
types.description: The content of a user's message to a room.

fields.name: fragments
fields.description: Parsed list of fragments in the message, include emotes, mentions, and plaintext.

fields.name: text
fields.description: String representation of the user message.

types.name: RoomMessageFragment
types.description: One parsed part of a message, which may be an emote, mention, or plaintext.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Contains an emote or a mentioned user depending on the text of the fragment.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Plaintext representation of the fragment.

types.name: FragmentContent
types.description:
FragmentContent contains the parse content of a fragment, and can be an emote or a mention.
NOTE: should have been called RoomMessageFragmentContent.

types.name: AutoMod
types.description:
An automod fragment type, which is text that is flagged by AutoModeration.
It contains a list of topics which contain reasons why AutoModeration flagged the text.

fields.name: topics
fields.description: The topics that were flagged by AutoModeration.

types.name: AutoModTopic
types.description: An auto moderation topic with value.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The topic type, defined by Zuma.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: The weight assigned to the topic.

types.name: CheermoteToken
types.description: CheermoteToken is used to render a cheermote in a message.

fields.name: bitsAmount
fields.description: The number of bits in the cheermote.

fields.name: prefix
fields.description: The prefix of the cheermote (e.g. cheer in cheer100).

fields.name: tier
fields.description:
The tier of the cheer used to determine which image to show for the cheermote.
In cheer150, this would be 100.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The emote's identifier.
For example, "115847".

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user who owns the subscription product that this emote belongs to.

fields.name: setID
fields.description: Identifies which set this emote belongs to.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of an emote. Can be either active or pending.

fields.name: subscriptionProduct
fields.description: The subscription product this emote belongs to. Nil for globals.

fields.name: text
fields.description:
The visual representation of the emote.
For example, "O_o" instead of "(O|o)_(o|O)".

fields.name: token
fields.description:
The text token of the emote.
For example, "KappaHD".

types.name: User
types.description: Twitch user.

fields.name: accountConnections
fields.description: Information about a user's connected accounts.

fields.name: activity
fields.description:
An action that a user or session is performing. This field is null if the user is not friends with
the authenticated user.

fields.name: adProperties
fields.description: Ad Properties for the given user.

fields.name: amazon
fields.description: The user's relationship with Amazon.

fields.name: amazonMarketplaces
fields.description: amazonMarketplaces returns a list of Amazon marketplaces in which this user is active in.

fields.name: autoModProperties
fields.description:
AutoModProperties is a mapping of automod categories to levels, i.e. a user has indicated they want level 4, or
the highest level of moderation for profanity, but level 1 for everything else.

fields.name: autohostChannels
fields.description:
The list of channel that this user has configured to automatically host
when their channel is not streaming live. Users can only view their own
autohost channels.

fields.name: autohostSettings
fields.description:
Options and preferences for autohost behavior, including whether
autohosting is enabled at all and how to choose which channel to host.
Users can only view their own autohost settings.

fields.name: availability
fields.description:
An action that a user or session is performing. This field is null if the user is not friends with
the authenticated user.

fields.name: availableBadges
fields.description:
The badges which are available for the authenticated user to select for use on another user's streams and videos if no channel-specific preference is set.
If no domain is not specified, all emote sets will be returned.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user whose email is requested.

fields.name: bannedUsers
fields.description:
A list of this user's banned users.
A maximum of 100 users by most recent are returned
Only resolves for the authenticated user.

fields.name: bannerImageURL
fields.description: A URL to the user's banner image.

fields.name: bitsBalance
fields.description:
bitsBalance is the number of bits this user currently has available to spend.
If this isn't the `currentUser` or the user has been banned from using bits this will return null.
This field can only be requested if an OAuth token is supplied with the request.

fields.name: bitsOffers
fields.description:
bitsOffers is a list of the ways this user can obtain more bits.
If this isn't the `currentUser` or the user has been banned from using bits this will return null.
This field can only be requested if an OAuth token is supplied with the request.

fields.name: bitsPaymentMethods
fields.description: BitsPaymentMethods has a list of eligible payment methods for a user to transact with.

fields.name: bitsProducts
fields.description:
BitsProductEligibility checks for a given user if they are eligible to purchase a given product from the associated
provider, quantity, and locale.
bitsProduct(id: ID!, provider: BitsProductProvider!, quantity: Int!, locale: String!): BitsProductEligibility!
bitsProducts is a list of bits products that a user is able to purchase.
Unlike bitsOffers, this does not return any pricing information, only information
about the purchaseable. A provider must be supplied, which is the payment platform
being currently used. An optional list of SKUs can be provided if we are looking up
a specific set of products for a user.

fields.name: bitsUserSettings
fields.description: Settings tied to a bits user.

fields.name: bitsUserState
fields.description:
bitsUserState dictates the state of the Bits user (new to Bits, existing Bits user, etc.)
If this isn't the `currentUser` or the user has been banned from using bits this will return null.
This field can only be requested if an OAuth token is supplied with the request.

fields.name: blizzardAccount
fields.description: Resolves account information that Twitch has stored for a user's blizzard account information.

fields.name: blockedTerms
fields.description: Get the blocked terms of a user.

fields.name: blockedUsers
fields.description: blockedUsers returns a list users that are restrained from directly communicating with this user.

fields.name: bounties
fields.description: bounties is a list of bounty board bounties for this user.

fields.name: bountyBoardSettings
fields.description: bountyBoardSettings are settings and rules around the behavior of bounty boards for this user.

fields.name: broadcastBadges
fields.description: Badges that are displayed in chat during this user's broacasts or videos.

fields.name: broadcastSettings
fields.description: A User's broadcast settings that persists between streams.

fields.name: campaign
fields.description: A User's campaign for their channel.

fields.name: campaignProperties
fields.description: A User's campaign properties for their channel.

fields.name: channel
fields.description:
The channel which belongs to the user. This is still deprecated for previous uses.
This should only be used for the multi-view experience.

fields.name: channelAnalyticsContentOverlap
fields.description: What other similar content are my viewers watching.

fields.name: channelFeed
fields.description:
A user's channel feed.
No authorization required.  Returns even if channel feed is disabled in the UI.

fields.name: channelRooms
fields.description: Returns the list of chatrooms in the channel visible by the current user.

fields.name: chatColor
fields.description: Hex color of the user's name in chat, e.g. "#ccaa44".

fields.name: chatSettings
fields.description: chatSettings are settings and rules for chatting in this user's channel.

fields.name: chatUISettings
fields.description: chatUISettings are settings for the user's chat UI.

fields.name: cheer
fields.description:
cheer is the channel-specific cheer settings and current state.
Returns null if cheering isn't enabled for this channel.

fields.name: clientAuthorizations
fields.description: The list of OAuth clients authorized by the current user.

fields.name: clips
fields.description:
A paginated list of clips featuring this user.
When criteria is not specified, the default values are used.

fields.name: collections
fields.description: A paginated list of collections (playlists) created by the user.

fields.name: company
fields.description:
The company that the user belongs to.
Returns null if the user doesn't belong to a company.

fields.name: crates
fields.description:
A list of Twitch crates in a user's inventory.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user who's email is requested.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the user created their account.

fields.name: dashboardActivityFeedActivities
fields.description:
Paginated past activities for the Dashboard Activity Feed.
Always ordered by descending timestamp.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A user-provided blurb describing themselves.

fields.name: directories
fields.description: The directories the user is currently set to broadcast in.

fields.name: displayBadges
fields.description:
Lists the chat badges that should be displayed by the user's display name in
features like chat and whispers. If a channelID is passed in, fetches the
display badges that user will have in that channel's context.
Includes the following badges:
- global authority (staff/admin/global mod)
- channel authority (broadcaster/mod, if channelID is set)
- subscriber (if channelID is set)
- channel selected (bits) or global selected (prime, turbo, ...).

fields.name: displayName
fields.description:
A user-styled version of their login.
For international users, this could be the user's login with localized characters.

fields.name: editors
fields.description: A list of channel editors.

fields.name: email
fields.description:
The user's email address.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user who's email is requested.

fields.name: emoteSets
fields.description:
The emote sets this user is entitled to use.
If no domains are specified, all emote sets will be returned.
If multiple domains are specified, emotes that belong to either domain are returned (OR).
If this user is not the current user, it returns nil and a "forbidden" error.

fields.name: emoticonPrefix
fields.description: The channel's emoticon prefix settings.

fields.name: eventLeaves
fields.description:
Paginated list of leaf events that will or have run on theis user's channel.
This selects *all* leaves of all collections that this user might have assocated as well.
An optional criteria object can be given to specify the relevant time window that events should fall within, and
how the events are sorted.
NOTE: If no time window is given, this field will only contain upcoming events.

fields.name: events
fields.description:
Paginated list of events that will or have run on this user's channel.
An optional criteria object can be given to specify the relevant time window that events should fall within, and
how the events are sorted.
NOTE: If no time window is given, this field will only contain upcoming events.

fields.name: expiredSubscriptions
fields.description:
A paginated list of user's all expired subscriptions.
Only resolves for the current user. Returns a forbidden error if requested for another user.

fields.name: featureFlags
fields.description:
Feature flags specific to this user.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user whose email is requested.

fields.name: follow
fields.description:
A follow relationship between this user and the one which has the target ID or login.
Null if no relationship exists.

fields.name: followedCommunities
fields.description:
A list of communities this user is following, ordered by most viewers.
Only resolves for the authenticated user.

fields.name: followedEvents
fields.description: Paginated list of events that this user is currently following.

fields.name: followedGames
fields.description: Retrieves a list of games which the user is following.

fields.name: followedHosts
fields.description:
A list of broadcasters this user follows, who are hosting other broadcasters.
Only resolves for the authenticated user.
fields.deprecationReason: This field is intended to be replaced as soon as an alternative is available.

fields.name: followedLiveUsers
fields.description:
A list of live-streaming broadcasters this user is following.
Only resolves for the authenticated user.
fields.deprecationReason: This field is intended to be replaced as soon as an alternative is available.

fields.name: followedVideos
fields.description:
Retrieves recent/popular VODs from the streamers you follow.
If this isn't the `currentUser` this will return null.

fields.name: followers
fields.description: A paginated list of users which follow this user.

fields.name: follows
fields.description: A paginated list of users this user is following.

fields.name: friends
fields.description:
A list of this user's Twitch friends.
A maximum of 500 friends are returned, although most users have less than the maximum.
Only accessible if the user is authenticated with the `user_presence_friends_read` scope.

fields.name: hasPrime
fields.description: Whether this user has Twitch Prime.

fields.name: hasTurbo
fields.description: Whether this user has Twitch Turbo.

fields.name: hostRecommendations
fields.description: A curated list of suggested channels to host.

fields.name: hosting
fields.description: The user who this user is hosting.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The user's unique identifier.

fields.name: idSHA1
fields.description: Returns a SHA-1 hash of the id field.

fields.name: incomingFriendRequests
fields.description:
A list of open friend requests sent to this user. Friend requests from non-strangers are always placed in front of
friend requests from strangers; `sort` affects how the two components are ordered within themselves. Only accessible
if the user is authenticated with the `user_presence_friends_read` scope.

fields.name: incomingSquadStreamInvitations
fields.description:
A list of the squad stream invitations that the user has received.
Each invitation has a network type of either in-network or out-of-network. The invitations are sorted by creation
time, with the latest invitation first.
This field only resolves for the authenticated user.

fields.name: installedExtensions
fields.description: The list of extensions the user has installed.

fields.name: inventory
fields.description: Items (crates, drops, etc.) the user owns.

fields.name: isCommerceRevShareEnabled
fields.description: Whether or not the broadcaster is eligible for payout through twitch game commerce revenue share.

fields.name: isConnectedToTwitter
fields.description:
Whether the user's Twitch account is connected to a Twitter account.
Returns nil if there was an error. This field is only accessible on the current user.

fields.name: isEmailReusable
fields.description: Whether or not the user has enabled their email to be reused to create another twitch account.

fields.name: isEmailVerified
fields.description: Whether or not the user has verified their email address by clicking a link sent to their email.

fields.name: isGlobalMod
fields.description: Whether or not the user can moderate any broadcast chat.

fields.name: isInGoodStanding
fields.description:
Whether or not the user is in good standing, granting automatic emote approval.
Authenticated to current user. Will error if not a partner.

fields.name: isMinimumGDPRConsentAge
fields.description: Whether the user meets the GDPR compliance as per his/her country's minimum compliance age.

fields.name: isModerator
fields.description: Whether or not the user is moderator of a another user's channel.

fields.name: isPartner
fields.description: Whether or not the user is a partnered broadcaster with Twitch.

fields.name: isSiteAdmin
fields.description: Whether or not the user is a site admininistrator.

fields.name: isStaff
fields.description: Whether or not the user is a Twitch staff member.

fields.name: keyPools
fields.description: The key pools associated with a user.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The user's language preference.

fields.name: lastBroadcast
fields.description: The user's last broadcast.

fields.name: lastStatusChangeAt
fields.description:
The last time the user's availability or activity changed.
This special field only resolves for the authenticated user; use friends.edges.lastStatusChangeAt to retrieve this
information about friends..
Requires the `user_presence_friends_read` scope.

fields.name: liveDeprecatedEvent
fields.description:
The event that the live stream is a part of.  If the channel is not live, or the stream is not associated with an
event, this field will be null.
fields.deprecationReason: Migratory field that clients who want to use the deprecated version of events can consume

fields.name: liveEvent
fields.description:
The event that the live stream is a part of.  If the channel is not live, or the stream is not associated with an
event, this field will be null.

fields.name: login
fields.description: The user's standard alphanumeric Twitch name.

fields.name: logoURL
fields.description:
The user's profile image.
Valid widths are 28, 50, 70, 150, 300, and 600.
The image height will be the same as the given width.

fields.name: managedEventCollections
fields.description:
Paginated list of event collections owned by this User.
The event collections are sorted by title in ascending order.

fields.name: managedEventLeaves
fields.description: Paginated list of event leaves owned by this User.

fields.name: maxAllowedChannelRooms
fields.description:
Returns the max number of channel rooms that the current user is allowed to
create for their channel.

fields.name: modLogs
fields.description: Returns a resolver to query different subsets of the moderation logs.

fields.name: modLogsAccess
fields.description: Returns all channel roles' access permissions to moderator logs.

fields.name: modLogsRoleAccess
fields.description: Returns a channel role's access permission to moderator logs.

fields.name: mods
fields.description: Returns a paginated list of channel moderators.

fields.name: notificationSettings
fields.description: A user's event notification settings.

fields.name: notifications
fields.description:
A user's notifications.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user whose onsite notifications are requested.
`language` is a letter code for the language the requesting user speaks (ex. "en").

fields.name: offlineImageURL
fields.description: A URL to the image that is displayed when the user is not broadcasting nor hosting another user's broadcast.

fields.name: onboarding
fields.description: Information about the current user's onboarding state.

fields.name: outgoingFriendRequests
fields.description:
A list of open friend requests sent by this user. Friend requests to non-strangers are always placed in front of
friend requests to strangers; `sort` affects how the two components are ordered within themselves. Only accessible
if the user is authenticated with the `user_presence_friends_read` scope.

fields.name: panels
fields.description: panels is a list of `Panel` objects with information related to this channel.

fields.name: partnershipApplication
fields.description:
Non-partnered users can submit a partnership application via createPartnershipApplication mutation.
PartnershipApplication includes the status of the most recently submitted application.

fields.name: payPalBillingAgreement
fields.description: User's PayPal billing agreement.

fields.name: payPalBillingAgreementURL
fields.description: URL where user can create or update their PayPal billing agreement.

fields.name: paymentMethodConfigs
fields.description:
Holds configuration necessary to start payment method management. Only the authenticated user can access their own configs.
This is the second step of the payment method management flow.
(User.paymentMethods -> User.paymentMethodConfigs -> Mutation.setDefaultPaymentMethod).

fields.name: paymentMethods
fields.description:
List of payment methods that will be used to pay for Twitch subscriptions that renew in the future
This is the first step of the payment method management flow.
(User.paymentMethods -> User.paymentMethodConfigs -> Mutation.setDefaultPaymentMethod).

fields.name: paymentTransactions
fields.description:
Get user's list of payment transactions. This currently aggregates subscriptions related transactions but plans
to also aggregate other product types such as Bits. The ultimate goal is to record, aggregate, and provide the
payment history of Twitch users in a convenient way.

fields.name: payout
fields.description: Payout Information.

fields.name: payoutInvite
fields.description: A user's invite into a payout program.

fields.name: payoutPlans
fields.description: List of payout plans a user has when enrolled in any payout programs.

fields.name: permittedTerms
fields.description: Get the permitted terms of a user.

fields.name: primaryTeam
fields.description:
The primary team this user belongs to. A user may belong to more than one team at the same time but must select a single
team as the primary. If the user doesn't have a primary team this will be null.

fields.name: primeGift
fields.description: A user's prime gift for a provided offer. Nil if one does not exist or is not claimable.

fields.name: primeSettings
fields.description: The Twitch Prime settings data for the user.

fields.name: profileImageURL
fields.description:
A URL to the user's profile image.
Valid widths are 28, 50, 70, 150, 300, and 600.
The image height will be the same as the given width.

fields.name: profileURL
fields.description:
The URL to viewing this user's profile.
This is typically https://twitch.tv/<login> .

fields.name: profileViewCount
fields.description: The number of views this user's profile has received since creation.

fields.name: programAgreement
fields.description: The program agreement for a user enrolled in a payout program.

fields.name: pulseFeed
fields.description:
A user's pulse feed.
This is only returned if the request is authenticated by the same user whose email is requested.

fields.name: recommendationFeedback
fields.description: The feedback a user has given about recommended content.

fields.name: recommendations
fields.description:
Recommendations for the user. Recommendations can be retrieved only if the request
is authenticated and only for the authenticated user.

fields.name: relationship
fields.description: This user's relationship with another user.

fields.name: residence
fields.description: User's declared country of residence.

fields.name: roles
fields.description: The roles this user fulfills on Twitch.

fields.name: searchVideos
fields.description: Search through a paginated list of public and private videos for this user.

fields.name: selectedBadge
fields.description: The badge this user has selected for global use on Twitch.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The authenticated user's relationship with this user.

fields.name: settings
fields.description: The settings this user has on Twitch.

fields.name: squadStream
fields.description:
The squad stream that this user is currently a member of, or null if the user is not a member of
any squad stream.

fields.name: squadStreamSettings
fields.description: This field only resolves for the authenticated user.

fields.name: ssoLinks
fields.description: The relationship between the authenticated user and the single sign-on (SSO) apps they have linked to their Twitch account.

fields.name: stream
fields.description:
The user's live stream.
Null if the user is not currently broadcasting.

fields.name: subscribedChannels
fields.description:
A list of channels to which the user is subscribed.
Only resolves for the authenticated user.

fields.name: subscriberScore
fields.description:
The subscription score of the user. Returns both a breakdown of subscriptions and points by tier.
Authenticated to the current user. Will be nil if the user is not a partner or affiliate.

fields.name: subscriptionBenefits
fields.description:
A paginated list of user's all active subscriptions.
Only resolves for the current user. Returns a forbidden error if requested for another user.

fields.name: subscriptionProducts
fields.description: A list of subscription products available for purchase on the user's page.

fields.name: subscriptionSettings
fields.description:
Subscription preferences for the current user.
Only resolves for the current user. Returns an error if request for another user.

fields.name: tournament
fields.description: Tournament associated with the user. This is used with the Bits custom cheering experience.

fields.name: twitch
fields.description: The user's relationship with Twitch.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When the user last updated their account.

fields.name: verificationRequest
fields.description:
Verification request object for the user and an associated contact address.
If no address is provided, the current email address associated with the user account will be used.

fields.name: videoShelves
fields.description: A paginated list of video shelves the user has specified for displaying their content.

fields.name: videos
fields.description: A paginated list of videos for this user.

fields.name: viewedVideos
fields.description:
A paginated list of viewed videos and their histories for this user.
Only resolves for current user.

fields.name: vips
fields.description: A paginated list of channel VIPs.

fields.name: whisperThreads
fields.description: A paginated list of whisper threads for the current user, sorted by recent first.

types.name: AccountConnectionSet
types.description: The information about all of a user's connected accounts.

fields.name: blizzard
fields.description: Connection information about a user's Blizzard account.

fields.name: facebook

fields.name: hasConnectedAmazon
fields.description: Whether or not the user has a linked amazon account.

fields.name: steam
fields.description: Connection information about a user's Steam account.

fields.name: twitter
fields.description: Connection information about a user's Twitter account.

fields.name: youtube
fields.description: Connection information about a user's Youtube account.

types.name: UserBlizzardConnectionLink
types.description: The edge between a User and a Blizzard connection.

fields.name: battleTag
fields.description: Returns battletag if available. Can be string or nil.

types.name: UserFacebookConnectionLink
types.description: The edge between a User and a Facebook connection.

fields.name: fullName
fields.description: The user's full name on Facebook. eg. "John Doe".

types.name: UserSteamConnectionLink
types.description: The edge between a User and a Steam connection.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A Steam user ID.

types.name: UserTwitterConnectionLink
types.description: The edge between a User and a Twitter connection.

fields.name: username
fields.description: A Twitter username, without the "@" (eg. "Twitch").

types.name: UserYoutubeConnectionLink
types.description: The edge between a User and a Youtube Connection.

fields.name: channelURL
fields.description: The URL for the user's Youtube channel.

types.name: Activity
types.description: An action (and metadata about the action) which a user or session is performing.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of activity.

types.name: ActivityType
types.description: The categories of activities which users can engage in.

types.name: AdProperties
types.description: Ad Properties is an object that defines ad properties for a channel.

fields.name: adServer
fields.description: Which adserver to send requests to.

fields.name: adServerDefault
fields.description: Which adserver to send requests to.

fields.name: adasProperties
fields.description: Amazon Digital Ad Service (ADAS) specific Properties for this channel. Properties should only be nested if it is ADAS specific.

fields.name: frequency
fields.description: How often ad breaks can be run on this channel.

fields.name: hasPostrollsDisabled
fields.description: If postrolls are disabled on this channel.

fields.name: hasPrerollsDisabled
fields.description: If prerolls are disabled on this channel.

fields.name: hasTurboDisabled
fields.description: If Turbo benefit is disabled on this channel.

fields.name: hasVodAdsEnabled
fields.description: If vod ads are enabled on this channel.

fields.name: maxAdBreakLength
fields.description: Maximum length for an ad break on this channel.

fields.name: requiredAge
fields.description: The stream has the required age gate enabled if greater than 0.

fields.name: trackingPixels
fields.description: Tracking pixels that channel pages should fire at certain intervals.

fields.name: vodArchiveMidrolls
fields.description: Setting for vod archive midrolls on this channel. Can be 'broadcaster', 'inserted', or 'off'.

fields.name: vodArchiveMidrollsBreakLength
fields.description: Ad break length for VOD archive midrolls on this channel.

fields.name: vodArchiveMidrollsFrequency
fields.description: Frequency for VOD archive midrolls on this channel.

types.name: ADASProperties
types.description: Amazon Digital Ad Service Properties.

fields.name: partner
fields.description: The media partner that should be used for the ad break.

fields.name: programID
fields.description: The id for selecting the amazon ad campaign or program.

types.name: GDPRConsent
types.description: GDPR Consent contains user consent on different tracking vendors.

inputFields.name: allowAmazon
inputFields.description: Whether Amazon has user GDPR consent.

inputFields.name: allowComscore
inputFields.description: Whether Comscore has user GDPR consent.

inputFields.name: allowGoogle
inputFields.description: Whether Google has user GDPR consent.

inputFields.name: allowNielsen
inputFields.description: Whether Nielson has user GDPR consent.

inputFields.name: allowSalesforce
inputFields.description: Whether Salesforce has user GDPR consent.

types.name: TrackingPixel
types.description: A tracking pixel is used to measure impressions or demographics.

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Where this pixel came from.

fields.name: timeOffsetSeconds
fields.description: How long a client needs to view the content before firing the pixel.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of tracker.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL that is requested when the pixel is fired.

types.name: TrackingPixelType
types.description: The type of the tracking pixel.

enumValues.name: DAR
enumValues.description: Digital Ad Ratings, a Nielsen product that provides demographic data.

enumValues.name: DCM
enumValues.description: DoubleClick Campaign Manager, a Google product to track ad performance.

enumValues.name: SIZMEK
enumValues.description: An impression tracking product.

types.name: UserAmazonConnection
types.description: The relationship between the user and Amazon.

fields.name: associatesStore
fields.description: The Amazon associates store linked to this user.

types.name: AssociatesStore
types.description: Information regarding an Amazon Associates store.

fields.name: isPayoutEnabled
fields.description: Whether the owner of this store is enabled to recieve payments.

fields.name: storeID
fields.description: The store ID tag.

types.name: AmazonMarketplace
types.description:
AmazonMarketplace represents the Amazon specific term for "marketplace", 
like www.amazon.com or www.amazon.fr, that a user is active in.

fields.name: displayText
fields.description: The display text for this Amazon Marketplace, like "www.amazon.com" or "www.amazon.fr".

fields.name: id
fields.description: The standard obfuscated Amazon Marketplace ID, like "ATVPDKIKX0DER".

fields.name: orderHistoryRedirectURL
fields.description: OrderHistoryRedirectUrl is the URL for the user's order history, specific to this Amazon Marketplace.

fields.name: aggressiveLevel
fields.description: These are integers between 0 and 4, inclusive.

types.name: AutohostChannelConnection
types.description:
A list of configured autohost channels

A relay connection type that does not yet support pagination.

types.name: AutohostSettings
types.description: A user's autohosting settings.

fields.name: deprioritizeVodcast
fields.description: True if this channels prefers autohost over vodcast.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: True if this channel has the autohost feature turned on.

fields.name: incomingRaidsPolicy
fields.description: Determines what other channels can raid this channel.

fields.name: strategy
fields.description: The strategy to use when choosing channels to autohost.

fields.name: teamHost
fields.description: True if this user autohosts their team members.

types.name: AutohostSettingsIncomingRaidsPolicy
types.description: Determines what other channels can raid this channel.

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: This user cannot be radied by anyone.

enumValues.name: NETWORK
enumValues.description: This user can be raided by other people in their network.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: This user can be raded by anyone.

types.name: AutohostSettingsStrategy
types.description: The strategy to use when choosing channels to autohost.

enumValues.name: ORDERED
enumValues.description: Picks channels in the order defined by the user.

enumValues.name: RANDOM
enumValues.description: Picks channels at random.

types.name: Availability
types.description: The possible computed states for a user or session.

types.name: BadgeDomain
types.description: Domains that badges belong to.

enumValues.name: CRATE
enumValues.description: Badges that were granted via Twitch crates.

types.name: Badge
types.description: Communicates a user's status in chat.

fields.name: clickAction
fields.description: Identifies an action to trigger when this badge is clicked.

fields.name: clickURL
fields.description: The URL to redirect to if the badge's clickAction is VISIT_URL.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
A localized, human-friendly description of the badge.
Defaults to English if no translation exists for the requested locale.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The badge's unique identifier.

fields.name: imageURL
fields.description: A URL to the badge's image.

fields.name: setID
fields.description: The identifier of the set which this badge belongs (e.g. "subscriber").

fields.name: title
fields.description:
A localized, human-friendly title for the badge.
Defaults to English if no translation exists for the requested locale.

fields.name: user
fields.description:
The badge's associated broadcaster.
Returns null if this is a global badge.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The badge's version (e.g. "1mo").

types.name: BadgeClickAction
types.description: Enumerates possible badge click actions.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIBE
enumValues.description: Go to the user's subscription page.

enumValues.name: GET_TURBO
enumValues.description: Go to the Twitch Turbo purchasing page.

enumValues.name: GET_BITS
enumValues.description: Go to the Bits purchasing page.

enumValues.name: VISIT_URL
enumValues.description: Redirect the user to the badge click URL.

types.name: BadgeImageSize
types.description: Enumerates valid badge image sizes.

enumValues.name: NORMAL
enumValues.description: The base badge image size: 18x18.

enumValues.name: DOUBLE
enumValues.description: Double the normal badge image size: 36x36.

enumValues.name: QUADRUPLE
enumValues.description: Quadruple the normal badge image size: 72x72.

types.name: ChannelBannedUser

fields.name: bannedAt

fields.name: bannedUser

fields.name: modUser

types.name: Time
types.description:
RFC3339 timestamp.
For example "2015-07-22T21:41:14Z".

enumValues.name: BUNDLE
enumValues.description: BUNDLE is a standard package of bits that can be purchased for a price.

enumValues.name: PAYPAL

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAY

types.name: BitsProduct
types.description: A product for bits that contains all information about a product, except for the pricing.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of bits the product is for.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The product ID.

fields.name: maxQuantity
fields.description: The maximum quantity a user can purchase at once.

fields.name: promo
fields.description: A field that contains promotional information about the product.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The relation of the product to the user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The product type, which right now is only "purchase".

types.name: BitsProductPromotion
types.description: Promotional information about bits products.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique ID of the bits product promo.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The localized title of the promo product.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of promotion the product is associated with. This type is not enumerable since it is very dynamic.

types.name: BitsProductSelfEdge
types.description: The relation of a Bits product to a user.

fields.name: eligibility
fields.description: Is the user eligible to claim the product at the given quantity.

fields.name: purchaseInfo
fields.description: Gets the preview price and tax info for the Bits purchase, or error if that failed.

types.name: BitsProductEligibility
types.description: The type used when checking bits product eligibility for a user.

fields.name: canPurchase
fields.description: A boolean that is true when the user is eligible for the product.

fields.name: reasonCode
fields.description:
If the user is ineligible for the product, then this code is set
as the reason why the user is ineligible for the product.

types.name: BitsProductPurchaseInfo
types.description: Contains the Bits product's preview price and tax info for a Bits purchase, and error if a preview cannot be created.

fields.name: error
fields.description: The error is present if purchase info failed to be retrieved.

fields.name: previewPriceInfo
fields.description: Gets the preview price and tax info for the Bits purchase.

types.name: BitsProductPurchaseInfoError
types.description: Error information shown when priceInfo could not be retrieved for Bits Product.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The descriptive error code.

types.name: BitsProductPurchaseInfoErrorCode
types.description: Possible errors when retrieving bits product purchase info.

enumValues.name: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
enumValues.description: An unexpected internal server error occurred.

enumValues.name: USER_UNAUTHORIZED
enumValues.description: The user is unauthorized to view purchase info.

enumValues.name: PRICING_ID_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: The Pricing ID is not found (404).

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN_USER_RESIDENCE
enumValues.description:
Cannot determine User Residence. Either billing address and IP doesn't match or
user doesn't have country of resident declared (409).

enumValues.name: BILLING_INFO_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: The billing info could not be found for the user and provider (410).

enumValues.name: PURCHASE_INELIGIBLE
enumValues.description: User is not eligible to purchase bits in this region (422).

types.name: PriceInfo
types.description:
Generic Price Information that supports taxing and multi region pricing.
LONG-TERM NOTE: using Int (32 bit) as a price field can cause issue when we sell products locally
e.g. 2147483648 (2^31) Lao Att = 253132 USD cent
Therefor, if we sell product which price more than $2500 in Laos currency. We will need to fix this.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The currency associated with the price of a subscription product.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description associated with pricing information.

fields.name: exponent
fields.description: The ISO-4217 wording of deriving price.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Identifier used for caching.

fields.name: isTaxInclusive
fields.description: If the tax is already included in price.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The numerical price of a subscription product.

fields.name: tax
fields.description: The tax rate of localized product.

fields.name: total
fields.description: The total price given price and tax.

types.name: Currency
types.description: An enumeration of currencies being accepted by PriceInfo.

enumValues.name: USD
enumValues.description: United States currency.

enumValues.name: EUR
enumValues.description: Euro currency.

enumValues.name: GBP
enumValues.description: Pound currency.

types.name: BitsProductType
types.description: An enumerable that identifies bits product types.

enumValues.name: PURCHASED_PRODUCT
enumValues.description: A product that has to be purchased.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: An unknown product type.

types.name: BitsUserSettings
types.description: Settings tied to a bits user.

fields.name: firstCheerTutorial
fields.description: Settings specific to the first cheer tutorial.

types.name: FirstCheerTutorial
types.description: Settings specific to the first cheer tutorial.

fields.name: hasAbandoned
fields.description: Optional field that dictates whether a user has exited out of the first cheer tutorial by clicking out of the experience.

fields.name: hasSkipped
fields.description: Optional field that dictates whether a user has skipped the first cheer tutorial by clicking the skip button.

types.name: BitsUserState
types.description: An enumerable that dictates user's Bits usage state.

enumValues.name: NEW_USER
enumValues.description: The user has never used or acquired Bits.

enumValues.name: ACQUIRED
enumValues.description: The user has acquired Bits (purchased, watched ads, etc.) but has never used it.

enumValues.name: SKIPPED
enumValues.description: The user has never used or acquired Bits, but clicked "Skip" button to skip the first user experience.

enumValues.name: CHEERED
enumValues.description: The user has cheered before.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The user state is unknown.

types.name: Game
types.description: A Game is often the subject of a Stream on Twitch.

fields.name: activeDropCampaigns
fields.description: What campaigns are active for this game.

fields.name: avatarURL
fields.description:
URL to an avatar image.
The image dimensions are specifiable via the `height` and `width` parameters.

If `height` or `width` are not specified, the URL will contain
the template strings `{height}` and/or `{width}` in their respective places.

fields.name: boxArtURL
fields.description:
URL to a box art image.
The image dimensions are specifiable via the `height` and `width` parameters.

If `height` or `width` are not specified, the URL will contain
the template strings `{height}` and/or `{width}` in their respective places.

fields.name: broadcastersCount
fields.description: Number of broadcasters streaming this game.

fields.name: channelsCount
fields.description: Number of channels currently streaming this game.

fields.name: clips
fields.description:
A paginated list of clips featuring this game, ordered by view count descending.
When criteria is not specified, the default values are used.

fields.name: coverURL
fields.description:
URL to a cover image.
The image dimensions are specifiable via the `height` and `width` parameters.

If `height` or `width` are not specified, the URL will contain
the template strings `{height}` and/or `{width}` in their respective places.

fields.name: directoryType
fields.description: The type of directory  in this case, always GAME.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A publicly visible name used for display purposes.

fields.name: featuredEventBroadcasts
fields.description: Events that are featured for this game.

fields.name: featuredEventsByTime
fields.description: Events that are featured for this game.

fields.name: followersCount
fields.description: Number of users that follow this game.

fields.name: giantBombID
fields.description: The game's unique GiantBomb identifier.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The game's unique Twitch identifier.
It is used to associate games with product offers.

fields.name: logoURL
fields.description:
URL to a game logo image.
The image dimensions are specifiable via the `height` and `width` parameters.

If `height` or `width` are not specified, the URL will contain
the template strings `{height}` and/or `{width}` in their respective places.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the game.

fields.name: popularityScore
fields.description: A measure of the games popularity.

fields.name: product
fields.description:
Commerce-related details for this game including purchase information.
If no commerce items are available this will be null. If a client only
needs to check for the existence of game details without loading those
details it should request only the `GameProduct.id` field and check
if the resulting object is null or not.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The authenticated user's relationship with this Game.

fields.name: streams
fields.description:
Get a page of live streams broadcasting this game.
The languages param can be used to filter the streams. Otherwise all languages will be returned.
The filters param contains additional metadata filters, for example {hearthstoneGameMode: "arena"}.
The sort param can be used to change the default sorting, which sometimes is specific to specific games.
The tags param are an array of tag ID as optional filters for streams.
DEPRECATED field arguments: languages, requestID, sort, tags
Use GameStreamOptions instead.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: List of recommeded tags in the corresponding category.

fields.name: videos
fields.description: A paginated list of top videos for this game.

fields.name: viewersCount
fields.description: Number of viewers currently watching a stream which features this game.

fields.name: id

fields.name: isDirectoryHidden

fields.name: isPartner

Whether or not viewers of this stream can receive drops.
Note: Actually earning drops additionally requires that the game have an
active drops campaign and is done at the discretion of the developer.

fields.name: language

fields.name: lastUpdatedAt

fields.name: maxHeight
fields.description: The maximum height of the stream's video, in pixels.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: Platform-specific (e.g. Xbox, PlayStation) metadata.

fields.name: previewImageURL
fields.description:
A URL to a dynamically sized image.
If either `height` or `width` are not given, a templated value will be present instead.

fields.name: retailOffers
fields.description:
Retail products to be displayed alongside this stream (broadcaster + game).
Will only include a small number (<10) of products per stream, so no pagination needed.

fields.name: self
fields.description: self contains information on the relationship between the current user (anonymous or authenticated) and this stream.

fields.name: streamMetadata
fields.description: Metadata about the game being played in the stream.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Tag(s) are used as a discovery and search mechanism for tags and tagged content.

fields.name: title
fields.description: A user-defined title describing the stream.
fields.deprecationReason: Title field in Users has been deprecated. Use broadcaster.broadcastSettings.title instead

fields.description: What type of stream this is (e.g. live, playlist, watch_party).

fields.name: viewersCount
fields.description: The number of viewers currently watching the stream.

fields.name: width

A paginated list of clips for this video.
When criteria is not specified, the default values are used.

fields.name: comments
fields.description: A paginated list of comments against this video.

fields.name: contentTags
fields.description: A list of tags describing the video.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time the video metadata record was created.

fields.name: creator
fields.description:
The user who created this video.
This will be either the broadcaster or one of their editors.

fields.name: deletedAt
fields.description: NOTE: named `deleteAt` in Vinyl.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of the video, formatted in markdown.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: The length of the video.
fields.deprecationReason: Use length instead, as it's easier to parse.

fields.name: game
fields.description: The game the video is depicting.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The video's identifier.

fields.name: isDeleted
fields.description: Whether the video has been soft deleted.

fields.name: language
fields.description: Which language the video is in.

fields.name: lengthSeconds
fields.description: The length of the video, as an int, in seconds.

fields.name: moments
fields.description: A list of moments for this video.

fields.name: muteInfo
fields.description:
Publicly available muted segment info, detailing which parts of the video
have had audio removed.

fields.name: offsetSeconds
fields.description:
For highlights, the number of seconds offset from the beginning of the past broadcast the highlight starts.
For past broadcasts and uploads, this means nothing.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The owner of the video.

fields.name: previewThumbnailURL
fields.description:
The URL to the thumbnail which should be displayed for the video.
If either `height` or `width` are not given, a templated value (i.e. `{height}`, `{width}`) will be present in the URL instead.

fields.name: publishedAt
fields.description:
The time when the archive/highlight/upload was first ever available to public,
even if it is not currently public.

fields.name: reactions
fields.description: The reactions associated with this video.

fields.name: recordedAt
fields.description: The time the video was recorded.

fields.name: restriction
fields.description:
The reason a video is restricted if the given video is a restricted video.
For a video that is not restricted, this field can be null.

fields.name: scope
fields.description: Either PRIVATE or PUBLIC.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The authenticated user's relationship with this video.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
When broadcastType is:
- ARCHIVE: status goes from RECORDING to RECORDED.
- HIGHLIGHT: status goes from UNPROCESSED to RECORDED.
- UPLOAD: status goes from CREATED to UPLOADING, to PENDING_TRANSCODE, to RECORDED, or FAILED if anything goes wrong.
- PREMIERE_UPLOAD: status goes from CREATED to UPLOADING, to PENDING_TRANSCODE, to RECORDED, or FAILED if anything goes wrong.
- PAST_PREMIERE: status goes from RECORDING to RECORDED.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: An array of tags describing the video. This field will be deprecated soon. Please use `Video.contentTag` instead.

fields.name: thumbnailURLs
fields.description:
A list of thumbnail URLs for the video, ordered by descending priority.
Owners can insert custom thumbnails into this list.
If either `height` or `width` are not given, a templated value (i.e. `{height}`, `{width}`) will be present in the URL instead.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the video.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The most recent time the video data was updated.

fields.name: viewCount
fields.description: The numer of views this video has. Can be delayed by up to 15 minutes.

fields.name: viewableAt
fields.description:
For a scheduled video, the time when the video will be made available to the
public (the time when the scope will be automatically set to "public").
For a video that is public or not scheduled, is null.

enumValues.description: If the video is of a past broadcast, it's an ARCHIVE.

enumValues.name: HIGHLIGHT

enumValues.name: UPLOAD

enumValues.name: PREMIERE_UPLOAD
enumValues.description: When the video is directly uploaded to Twitch via the video manager, it's an PREMIERE_UPLOAD.

enumValues.name: PAST_PREMIERE
enumValues.description: When a video has been premiered on Twitch and is saved, it's a PAST_PREMIERE.

types.name: Clip
types.description: A recorded, replayable part of a live broadcast.

fields.name: broadcast
fields.description:
The broadcast of the clip. This should only be used to fetch the ID of the broadcast.
Because not all videos have broadcasts (e.g. uploads), not all clips will have a broadcast.

fields.name: broadcaster
fields.description: The broadcaster from which the clip originated.

fields.name: champBadge
fields.description:
The curator's clip champ badge if it has been attained on the broadcaster's channel.
This will be null if the curator is not a clip champ of the broadcaster's channel.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time when the clip was created.

fields.name: creationState
fields.description:
Different video qualities are being created in the background.
The creation state indicates when the source quality clip is playable
and transcoding of the clip in other video qualities has begun.

fields.name: curator
fields.description: The user who created the clip.

fields.name: durationSeconds
fields.description: The duration of the clip, in seconds.

fields.name: embedURL
fields.description: The URL used in the embed player.

fields.name: game
fields.description: The game depicted in the clip.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The clip's unique identifier.

fields.name: isPublished
fields.description: Whether or not the clip has been published.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The language of the clip.

fields.name: rawMedia
fields.description: Metadata around the raw media.

fields.name: rawVideoQualities
fields.description: The different quality options of this clip's raw media used for editing.

fields.name: reactions
fields.description: The reactions associated with this clips.

fields.name: relatedClips
fields.description: Lists of related clips based on different algorithms.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: A URL-friendly identifier.

fields.name: thumbnailURL
fields.description:
A URL to a thumbnail image.
Valid sizes are "86x45", "260x147", and "480x272".

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the clip.

fields.name: url
fields.description: A URL to the clip's page.

fields.name: video
fields.description:
The video of the clip. Because not all broadcasts are archived, not all clips will
have a video.

fields.name: videoOffsetSeconds
fields.description: The number of seconds into a VOD this clip was generated from.

fields.name: videoQualities
fields.description:
The different quality options of this clip available for playback.
The clip will first be available in the source video quality, indicated by when the
clipCreationState is 'CREATED'. videoQualities will gradually be added to afterwards as
more video quality options become playable.

fields.name: viewCount
fields.description: The number of times this clip has been viewed.

types.name: ClipCreationState
types.description: An enumeration on the different status strings returned by a clip status.

enumValues.name: CREATING
enumValues.description:
The creating status indicates that the source quality video is still
undergoing processing and transcoding.

enumValues.name: CREATED
enumValues.description:
Clip has been successfully created in the source video quality.
The field videoQualities will be gradually added to with other quality options.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description:
Clip creation failed and will remain in this state.
Possible errors can happen due to problems in downloading and slicing
the source of the original video, clipping offline channels, transcoding, etc.

types.name: ClipRawMedia
types.description: ClipRawMedia describes metadata about the clip's raw media used in clip editing.

fields.description: Default Offset is the seconds into the raw clip media the default clip begins at.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Total duration of the raw media.

fields.name: filmStripFrames
fields.description: Total number of frames displayed in the spritesheet film strip.

fields.name: filmStripSecondsPerFrame
fields.description: Seconds covered by each frame in the spritesheet film strip.

fields.name: frameHeight
fields.description: Height of the frames displayed.

fields.name: frameWidth
fields.description: Width of the frames displayed.

fields.description: Spritesheet displayed to user for clip editing.

fields.description: Status of the clip's raw media.

fields.description: URL link to the video mp4 containing to upwards of 90 seconds of the raw video from which the clip can be created from.

types.name: ClipVideoQuality
types.description: ClipVideoQuality describes metadata about an available playback source for a clip.

fields.name: frameRate
fields.description:
Frame rate is the number of frames per second of this video.
This value is a 64-bit float, with a default value of 30.0,
and is used for supporting different playback speeds.
Frame rate will be empty for raw media video qualities.

fields.name: quality
fields.description:
Clips can have multiple playback qualities via transcoding.
Some examples of qualities include "1080", "720", "480", "360", and "source".

fields.name: sourceURL
fields.description: The source video URL for the clip in this specific playback quality.

fields.name: count
fields.description: count of users that reacted with a particular Emote.

fields.name: emote
fields.description: The Emote associated with the Reaction.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The authenticated user's relationship with this reaction.

fields.name: hasReacted
fields.description: Did the authenticated user react.

types.name: ClipRelatedClips
types.description:
There are different algorithms that return a different set of related clips.
They only return up to 4 clips per list.

fields.name: broadcaster
fields.description: Up-to 4  randomly selected, top viewed clips from the same broadcaster created within the last 4 days.

fields.name: combined
fields.description:
Up-to 10 clips, in order, combined from the other returned clip sets.
Clips are included in the priority of similar, broadcaster, game, and then top.

fields.name: curator
fields.description: Up-to 4  randomly selected, top viewed clips from the same user created within the last 4 days.

fields.name: game
fields.description: Up-to 4  randomly selected, top viewed clips from the same game created within the last 4 days.

fields.name: similar
fields.description: Up-to 4 similar clips, based on the recommendations service.

fields.name: top
fields.description: Up-to 4 randomly selected, top viewed clips created within the last 4 days.

types.name: EmbeddedEmote
types.description:
EmbeddedEmote is an encoding format used to describe an emote embedded in a string of text.

Example:
  body = "hey KappaHD"
  from = 4
  to = 10

  "KappaHD" will be replaced with the KappaHD emote image.

fields.name: emoteID
fields.description: The emote's identifier, for example "115847" -> KappaHD.

fields.name: from
fields.description: from is the index of the string where replacement starts.

fields.name: setID
fields.description: setID is the identifier of the set this emote is in.

fields.name: to
fields.description: to is the index of the string where replacement ends.

enumValues.name: PUBLISHED
enumValues.description: The comment is published.

enumValues.name: UNPUBLISHED
enumValues.description: The comment was manually unpublished by a mod or the channel owner.

enumValues.name: PENDING_REVIEW

enumValues.name: PENDING_REVIEW_SPAM
enumValues.description: The comment is possibly spam and has to be reviewed by a moderator.

enumValues.name: DELETED
enumValues.description: The comment has been soft-deleted.

types.name: Duration

A possibly signed sequence of decimal numbers, each with optional fraction
and a unit suffix, such as "300ms", "-1.5h" or "2h45m".
Valid time units are "ns", "us" (or "s"), "ms", "s", "m", "h".

types.name: VideoMoment
types.description:
A video moment represents either a point in time, or a duration of time,
during which structured metadata is present.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: channel the VOD belongs to.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Time at which the moment was created.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
The displayable context of this moment (translated, where applicable). For
instance, the stream marker comment, game name for game change, or Pack opening
for Hearthstone VCA. Can be null.

fields.name: details
fields.description:
A union of the fields that are specific to individual moments, such as Game Mode
inside Hearthstone VCA data.

fields.name: durationMilliseconds
fields.description: The duration, in ms, that this moment is applicable, or zero if no duration.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the moment.

fields.name: moments
fields.description: Moments that cover a time range can also contain moments for that time range.

fields.name: positionMilliseconds
fields.description: The time, in ms, after the start of the video when this moment occurs.

fields.name: subDescription
fields.description:
The additional displayable context of this moment (translated, where applicable).
Can be null.

fields.name: thumbnailURL
fields.description:
The url to the thumbnail for this moment.
Can be null.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The underlying moment type.

fields.name: video
fields.description: The id of the video this moment is contained in.

types.name: VideoMomentDetails
types.description:
A union of the fields that are specific to individual moments, such as Game Mode
inside Hearthstone VCA data.

A list of all sections of the video that are muted.
If pagination is required at any point in the future, put edges and pageInfo
in this type.

fields.description: No pagination functionality. All data returned in initial call.

types.description: Information about one contiguous muted portion of video.

fields.name: offset

types.description: Restrictions for viewing of a video. Resolves if a video is restricted, null otherwise.

fields.description: The product "short name" a user needs to purchase to view the video.

fields.description: The name of the product shown to users.

enumValues.name: PRIVATE
enumValues.description: The video is only viewable by the owner.

enumValues.name: PUBLIC
enumValues.description: The video is listed in search and anyone can view the video.

fields.name: isRestricted
fields.description: Can a user watch a restricted video.

fields.name: viewingHistory
fields.description: User's viewing history against a video.

types.name: VideoViewingHistory
types.description: User's viewing history against a video. All fields are null if no viewing history is available.

fields.name: position
fields.description: Position in seconds since the start of the video.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When the viewing history was last updated.

enumValues.name: RECORDING

enumValues.name: UNPROCESSED

enumValues.name: CREATED

enumValues.name: UPLOADING

enumValues.name: PENDING_TRANSCODE

enumValues.name: FAILED

enumValues.name: RECORDED

fields.name: activeChannelRestrictions
fields.description: A list of channel restrictions that are currently active on the channel for restricting a user's access to it.

fields.name: availableContentAttributes
fields.description: A list of content attributes created for the channel, that can be associated with the chanlets, to augment the multi-view experience.

fields.name: chanletStreamKey
fields.description: The stream key for this channel if it is a multi-view chanlet. The requesting user must "own" this chanlet to be authorized to see this.

fields.name: chanlets
fields.description: A list of the channel's chanlets (sub-channels) in a multi-view experience.

fields.name: contentAttributes
fields.description: For a multi-view chanlet, this is the list of content attributes that have been associated with the given chanlet.

fields.description: The channel's name, with user-specified formatting.

fields.name: followers
fields.description: A paginated list of the users who follow this channel.

fields.name: follows

fields.name: isHiddenChanlet
fields.description: Whether or not the channel is a hidden multi-view chanlet that is only meant to be accessible through another channel and not exist as a completely independent channel.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The channel's name.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user who owns this channel.

fields.name: profileBannerBackgroundColor
fields.deprecationReason: This field will be removed since it's unused.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The requesting user's relationship with the channel.

fields.name: status
fields.description: A user-defined status message.

fields.name: streams
fields.description: A list of streams for a given channel for multi-view.

fields.name: viewCount
fields.description: The number of views a channel has received in its lifetime.

types.name: ChannelRestriction
types.description: A restriction for a specific channel.

fields.name: endsAt

fields.name: exemptionInfo

types.name: ChannelRestrictionExemptionInfo

fields.name: exemptionType

types.name: MultiviewContentAttribute
types.description:
Multi-view content attribute(s) are used to augment the multi-view experience.
they are used for filterings and groupings of chanlets to help viewers find content that they are interested in.

fields.name: childIDs
fields.description: childIDs is an optional list of child content attribute ids.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Time when this content attribute is created.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is a unique identifier generated on the server side.

fields.name: imageURL
fields.description: URL to the image (icon) of the content attribute.

fields.name: key
fields.description: key is a grouping identifier for content attributes of the same type.

fields.name: name
fields.description: name is a human-readable string of the content attribute type.

fields.name: ownerChannel
fields.description: ownerChannel is the channel that this content attribute is created under.

fields.name: parentID
fields.description: parentID is an optional pointer to specify the parent attribute.

fields.name: parentKey
fields.description: parentKey is an optional pointer to specifiy the key of the parent attribute.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Time when this content attribute is last modified.

fields.name: value
fields.description: value is the human-readble value of the attribute value.

fields.name: valueShortName
fields.description: valueShortName is an optional abbreviation of value.

types.name: ChanletSort
types.description: ChanletSort indicates the desired order of chanlets in the list returned by LoadChanletsByUserID.

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: ChanletSortNone indicates that the order of chanlets returned is insignificant to the client and is allowed to be arbitrary.

enumValues.name: VIEWER_COUNT
enumValues.description: ChanletSortViewerCount indicates chanlets should return sorted by viewer counts, descending.
