types.name: SubscriptionProduct
types.description:
A subscription that is purchasable by users.
Once purchased, the subscription entitles the user to use special emote sets on Twitch.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The subscription product's display name.

fields.name: emoteSetID
fields.description:
The identifier of an EmoteSet that a user gains access to use on Twitch,
when they purchase this product.

fields.name: emotes
fields.description:
A list of Emotes the user gains access to use on Twitch when they purchase
this product.

fields.name: giftPromotion
fields.description: The subscription product's promotion if it is active.

fields.name: hasAdFree
fields.description: Whether the subscription hides ads for the channel.

fields.name: hasFastChat
fields.description: Whether the subscribers of this product are affected by slow chat mode.

fields.name: hasSubOnlyChat
fields.description: Whether the channel has sub only chatroom restriction.

fields.name: hasSubonlyVideoArchive
fields.description: Whether the subscribers of this product are able to see the subs-only video archive.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The subscription product's identifier.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The interval that the product lasts for. Includes unit + duration.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The subscription product's name.

fields.name: owner
fields.description:
The Twitch user that is the owner of the channel associated with this subscription product.
This is null for SubscriptionProducts like 'turbo' that are not associated with any user.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The subscription's USD-formatted price, e.g. "$9.99".
fields.deprecationReason: Transitioning to priceInfo instead to support multi region pricing

fields.name: priceInfo
fields.description: PriceInfo holds the products pricing information such as currency, cost, and tax information.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The connection for user to the subscription product.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The avaliability state of the product. e.g. "active" or "inactive".

fields.name: thirdPartyTemplateSKU
fields.description:
ThirdPartytemplateSKU is used by the frontend to retrieve third party product information such
as price. templateSKU is exposed separately from purchaseSKU since retrieving purchaseSKU is a
more expensive operation. A user may not be able to purchase the templateSKU. Use purchaseSKU
when the user has indiciated they want to purchase.
Uses Client-ID to determine platform information and IP address to determine location.

fields.name: tier
fields.description: The tier of the product.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of subscription, e.g. "chansub" or "teamsub".

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL for this subscription's purchase page.

types.name: EmoteStateFilter
types.description: Used to filter emotes by state.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: Show all emotes, including active and pending.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: Show only active emotes.

types.name: SubscriptionPromotion
types.description: The promotion offer on subscription product.

fields.name: discountType
fields.description: The subscription's discount type (e.g. "PERCENT_OFF").

fields.name: discountValue
fields.description: The discount value of the subscription product (e.g. "50").

fields.name: newPrice
fields.description: The subscription's USD-formatted price after discount (e.g. "$2.49").

fields.name: oldPrice
fields.description: The subscription's USD-formatted price before discount (e.g. "$4.99").

types.name: SubscriptionPromotionDiscountType
types.description: Valid discount types for Subscription promotion.

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: No discount on subscription product.

enumValues.name: PERCENT_OFF
enumValues.description: Percent off discount on subscription product.

enumValues.name: FIXED_VALUE_OFF
enumValues.description: Fixed price discount on subscription product.

types.name: SubscriptionInterval
types.description: Represents the interval of a subscription product.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: The unit-less amount of time a subscription lasts for.

fields.name: unit
fields.description: Denotes the unit of the interval.

types.name: SubscriptionIntervalUnit
types.description: Denotes the unit of the period of a subscription product.

enumValues.name: WEEK
enumValues.description: This subscription product lasts X weeks.

enumValues.name: MONTH
enumValues.description: This subscription product lasts X months.

enumValues.name: YEAR
enumValues.description: This subscription product lasts X years.

enumValues.name: ONE_TIME
enumValues.description: This subscription product lasts forever.

types.name: SubscriptionProductSelfConnection
types.description: The connection between the user and subscription product.

fields.name: benefit
fields.description: This user's subscription benefit information for the subscription product.

fields.name: checkoutConfigs
fields.description:
Holds configuration necessary to start subscription purchase checkout flow for this product for current user.
The user completing the checkout can get the subscription benefit for themself or for a gift recipient.
Only the authenticated user can access their own configs.
The user will be able to resubscribe their DNRd (do-not-renew) subs before their benefits expire. isReactivateRecurring allows
them to select between a non-recurring (one-month extension) and recurring re-subscription.
fields.deprecationReason: Transitioning to checkoutConfiguration that supports an input type

fields.name: checkoutConfiguration
fields.description: Holds configuration necessary to start subscription purchase checkout flow for this product for current user.

fields.name: discountType
fields.description: The subscription's discount type (e.g. "percent_off").

fields.name: discountValue
fields.description: The discount value of the subscription product (e.g. "50").

fields.name: isEligibleForDiscount
fields.description: If the product is eligible for a discount.

fields.name: newPrice
fields.description: The subscription's USD-formatted price after discount (e.g. "$2.49").

fields.name: oldPrice
fields.description: The subscription's USD-formatted price before discount (e.g. "$4.99").

fields.name: paidUpgradePromotion
fields.description: If the subscription product is eligible for a paid upgrade promotion.

fields.name: promotion
fields.description: The subscription product's promotion for user if eligible.

fields.name: purchase
fields.description:
This user's subscription purchase details for the subscription product. If this user is not
subscribed to the product, then the result's state is 'inactive'. If a compatible purchase exists,
then the result's "compatiblePurchase" field is present.

fields.name: thirdPartyPurchaseSKU
fields.description:
ThirdPartyPurchaseSKU is different from templateSKU since it represents the SKU of the exact item the
user will purchase. It is more expensive to retrieve purchaseSKU than templateSKU, so only
use purchaseSKU when the user has indicated they want to checkout. Use templateSKU on channel
page load to retrieve product information.

Will return an error if the user has no purchasable skus. Will return nil if not on a platform
with an external subscription product or if the country is not supported.
Uses Client-ID to determine platform information and IP address to determine location.

types.name: SubscriptionBenefit
types.description: Data about a user's subscription to a broadcaster.

fields.name: endsAt
fields.description: The date that the subscription benefit ends.

fields.name: gift
fields.description: gift resolves gift info about a SubscriptionBenefit.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier.

fields.name: intervalNumber
fields.description: For a recurring subscription, the price is charged at every interval i months.

fields.name: isDNRd
fields.description: Whether the sub is set to "do not renew".

fields.name: isRefundable
fields.description: Whether the subscription is in the grace period to be cancelled and refunded.

fields.name: originID
fields.description: The id of where the subscription originated from. Used when DNRing a recurring subscription.

fields.name: paidUpgrade
fields.description: If the subscriptionBenefit has a future dated paid upgrade. (ie. a user has upgraded a 1-month gift to a recurring subscription).
fields.deprecationReason: gift to paid upgrades will now be in the pendingSubscription schema

fields.name: pendingSubscription
fields.description: If the subscriptionBenefit has a pending future dated paid subscription.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: The platform the subscription was purchased on.

fields.name: product
fields.description: Resolves the product that the subscription benefit is to.

fields.name: purchasedWithPrime
fields.description: Whether this benefit was achieved using a Twitch Prime subscription.

fields.name: renewsAt
fields.description:
The date that the subscription benefit will renew. Will be nil if the subscription benefit
is not going to renew.

fields.name: thirdPartySKU
fields.description:
Exposes the third party SKU for managing third party subscriptions from the client.
Will be nil if there is not a thirdPartySKU associated with this subscription benefit.

fields.name: tier
fields.description: The subscription tier.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user who is subscribed to.

types.name: SubscriptionGift
types.description: Gift information for a subscription benefit.

fields.name: giftDate
fields.description: giftDate is the date that the gift was given.

fields.name: gifter
fields.description: Gifter is the user who sent the gift. Will be nil if isGift is false or is the gift is anonymous.

fields.name: isGift
fields.description: isGift says whether the subscription benefit is a gift or not.

types.name: PaidUpgrade
types.description:
Data about a paid upgrade for a subscription.
ie. a user upgrades a 1-month gift to a recurring subscription.

fields.name: originID
fields.description: The id of the paid upgrade purchase. Used to cancel the paid upgrade.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The formatted price of the paid upgrade in USD.

fields.name: priceInfo
fields.description: PriceInfo holds the paid upgrade's pricing information such as currency, cost, and tax information.

fields.name: startsAt
fields.description: The date the paid upgrade begins.

fields.name: tier
fields.description: Tier of upgraded product.

types.name: PendingSubscription
types.description:
Data about a pending future subscription.
ie. a user turns a 1-month gift into a recurring subscription.

fields.name: isCancelable
fields.description: Whether the pending sub is cancelable.

fields.name: originID
fields.description: The id of the pending subscription purchase. Used to cancel the paid upgrade.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The formatted price of the pending subscription in USD.

fields.name: priceInfo
fields.description: PriceInfo holds the pending subscription's pricing information such as currency, cost, and tax information.

fields.name: startsAt
fields.description: The date the pending subscription begins.

fields.name: tier
fields.description: Tier of pending subscription.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of pending subscription. Ie GIFT_TO_PAID for a gift to paid conversion.

types.name: PendingSubType
types.description: Denotes the type of pending subscription.

enumValues.name: GIFT_TO_PAID
enumValues.description: This pending subscription was a conversion from a gift sub to a paid sub.

enumValues.name: DNR_TO_RESUB_RECURRING
enumValues.description: This pending subscription was a conversion from a DNRd sub to a renewing sub.

enumValues.name: DNR_TO_RESUB_NONRECURRING
enumValues.description: This pending subscription was a conversion from a DNRd sub to a one month sub.

types.name: SubscriptionPlatform
types.description: SubscriptionPlatform enumerates platform options such as WEB, IOS, ANDROID.

enumValues.name: WEB
enumValues.description: Access from the browser.                                           ).

enumValues.name: IOS
enumValues.description: Access from the Twitch iOS application.

enumValues.name: ANDROID
enumValues.description: Access from the Twitch Android application.

types.name: SubscriptionCheckoutConfigs
types.description: Configs that help initiate the subscription checkout flow.

fields.name: canGift
fields.description: Whether the initiated checkout flow can complete/succeed and gift the recipient the product.

fields.name: canPurchase
fields.description: Whether the initiated checkout flow can proceed with a purchase.

fields.name: isOneMonthFreeEligible
fields.description: Whether the purchaser is eligible for a one-time promotion in the subscription purchase checkout flow.

fields.name: paymentProviderConfigs
fields.description: Holds configuration necessary for initializing payment provider client libraries and facilitate checkout flow.

fields.name: purchaseIneligibilityReason
fields.description: Purchase Ineligibility reason details.

fields.name: recurly
fields.description: Configs to initiate Recurly library for the user for purchase checkout or payment method update.

fields.name: xsolla
fields.description: Xsolla configs include the iframe URL for purchase checkout or payment method update.

fields.name: zuora
fields.description: Configs for initiating Zuora credit card payments or payment method update.

fields.name: braintreeClientAuthorization
fields.description: For interacting with the Braintree gateway and Paypal (supported by Recurly).

fields.name: payWithAmazonConfigs
fields.description: For interacting with Pay With Amazon gateway (supported by Recurly).

fields.name: publicKey
fields.description: Sent to Recurly to identify requests.

fields.name: clientID
fields.description: Used to configure PWA gateway and identify requests to Amazon.

fields.name: isProduction
fields.description: Frontend only has access to production PWA environment so this helps QA.

fields.name: sellerID
fields.description: Also known as merchant ID, which identifies the account accepting payments.

fields.name: iframeURL
fields.description:
Iframe URL to allow payment method management or purchase checkout
There are various cases in which this can be null. One example during
subscription purchase checkout flow is if there is an issue with the
Xsolla product mapping to the product in Twitch's system.

fields.name: externalAccountID
fields.description: Twitch merchant account ID on Zuora.

fields.name: hostedPageID
fields.description: ID of the hosted page we will render.

fields.name: hostedPageURL
fields.description: URL of the hosted page we will render.

fields.name: publicKey
fields.description: Used to encrypt sensitive information.

fields.name: signature
fields.description: Need to pass generated signature to access Zuora payment pages.

fields.name: tenantID
fields.description: In some cases, when you contact Zuora Support with an issue, the person helping you may ask you to provide the tenant ID.

fields.name: token

types.name: DropCampaign
types.description:
A campaign a developer is running to give drops away to viewers of their game
To be considered live, a campaign must be enabled with the current time
being after the start but before the end times
To apply to a particular channel a campaign must be live and additionally
the channel must be playing an applicable game and either must be one of the
applicable channels or the campaign must have an empty applicable channel list
(where an empty list specifically means all channels are eligible).

fields.name: applicableChannels
fields.description:
What channels this campaign is targeted to
(Empty list == all channels for the games are allowed)
An applicable channel must also be playing an applicable game for the
campaign to apply to the channel.

fields.name: applicableGames
fields.description:
The games that this campaign is enabled on
A channel playing one of these games must be in the applicable channels
list or list must be empty for the campaign to apply to the channel.

fields.name: awardableDrops
fields.description: The drops this campaign can award.

fields.name: connectionURL
fields.description:
The URL users who aren't linked should click on to create a link that will
allow them create an account link for the developer of the game(s)
this campaign is for.

fields.name: endAt
fields.description:
The time this campaign ends
To be considered live, a campaign must be enabled with the current time
being after the start but before the end times.

fields.name: id
fields.description: GUID identifying this campaign.

fields.name: isEnabled
fields.description:
If this campaign is enabled
To be considered live, a campaign must be enabled with the current time
being after the start but before the end times.

fields.name: startAt
fields.description:
The time this campaign starts
To be considered live, a campaign must be enabled with the current time
being after the start but before the end times.

types.name: Event
types.description:
An event represents a piece of scheduled content.  Events allow broadcasters to advertise their content
before it happens.  All events:

  * ... are routeable.  Each event has a URL that can be shared off-site.  The URL will usually resolve to a
    landing page that has information on the event, and content that happened during the event.
  * ... can be followed by Twitch users.  When a user follows an event, they get notifications on when the
    event goes live.

There are currently two high-level categories of events.  EventLeaf, which is a single event that may or may
not be part of a collection, or an EventCollection that groups leaves together.

types.name: EventCollection
types.description: An event collection represents a group of event leaves.

fields.name: channels
fields.description:
The channels where this event's children will be broadcast.
The channels will be returned in descending order by their associated events' popularity.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When this event was created.

fields.name: defaultTimeZone
fields.description:
The default time zone that this event's times should be displayed in when we don't have
access to the user's time zone.
defaultTimeZone is a tz database time zone name.  E.g. America/New_York.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of this event.

fields.name: endAt
fields.description: When this event will end.

fields.name: games
fields.description:
The games that will be played during this event.
The games will be returned in descending order by their associated events' popularity.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Event's unique identifier.

fields.name: imageURL
fields.description:
The URL or a URL template to the cover image for this event.
An optional width and height can be given to specify the dimension of the image in pixels.
If left unspecified, this field will be a URL template with {width} and {height} placeholders
that the client can replace to create a functional URL.
When width and height are given, this field is a full URL to the image.
The image is first scaled to maintain its aspect ratio, then cropped to fit the given dimensions.

fields.name: isDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether or not an event is deleted.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The language that this event is being run in.

fields.description: All leaf-esque events contained by this event.

fields.name: managedLeaves
fields.description: All leaf-esque events contained by this event that the currently authenticated user is allowed to manage.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user who owns this event.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The authenticated user's realtionship with this event.

fields.name: startAt
fields.description: When this event will start.

fields.name: stats
fields.description: The stats about engagement with this event.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of this event.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The named type of this event.

types.name: EventConnectionCriteriaInput
types.description: Generic options for filtering pages of events.

inputFields.name: endsAfter
inputFields.description: Select for events that end after this time.

inputFields.name: endsBefore
inputFields.description: Select for events that end before this time.

inputFields.name: firstPageOptions
inputFields.description:
Defines the strategies that are used to determine where the first page of events should start within the complete
list of events.  Moving forwards or backwards past this first page is possible using standard Relay pagination.
The options are processed in order, and if an option cannot be fulfilled (e.g. if the first option states to
start at a particular ID, but the ID does not exist in the list), then the next option is considered.
If no options can be fulfilled, or no options are given, the first page will start at the first event
after sorting and ordering.

inputFields.name: gameIDs
inputFields.description:
Select for events that involve at least one game that corresponds to the given game IDs.  If left unspecified,
no filtering by game is done.

inputFields.name: sortBy
inputFields.description: Sort by specific params; defaults to STARTTIME.

inputFields.name: sortOrder
inputFields.description: Sort order; defaults to ASC.

inputFields.name: startsAfter
inputFields.description: Select for events that start after this time.

inputFields.name: startsBefore
inputFields.description: Select for events that start before this time.

types.name: EventConnectionFirstPageInput
types.description:
Defines where the first page of a listing of events starts.
Each field allows specifying a strategy to pick the first event on the first page.  Clients should
only set one of these fields to choose a strategy, and leave the others null.

inputFields.name: endsAfter
inputFields.description:
The first page of the listing starts with the first event that has an end time after the given time.
This option is only applicable when sorting by start time in ascending order.

inputFields.name: eventID
inputFields.description:
The first event in the listing is the event that correspond to the given ID.
This option is applicable for all sort options and orderings.

types.name: EventSortBy
types.description: Sort field for events.

enumValues.name: STARTTIME
enumValues.description: Sort by the Start Time of the events.

enumValues.name: HYPE
enumValues.description: Sort by the Hype of the events.

types.name: DeprecatedEvent
types.description:
Deprecated

An event represents a piece of scheduled content.  Events allow broadcasters to advertise their content
before it happens.  All events:

  * ... are routeable.  Each event has a URL that can be shared off-site.  The URL will usually resolve to a
    landing page that has information on the event, and content that happened during the event.
  * ... can be followed by Twitch users.  When a user follows an event, they get notifications on when the
    event goes live.

The Event interface is the common set of fields that all events support.  There are several concrete Event types
that represent different kinds of scheduled content.  The kinds of content include one-off events, premieres,
tournaments, conferences and panels, shows and episodes etc.
The concrete Event types include additional fields that are needed to describe their kind of content.

NOTE: Clients should be resilient to new concrete types being added in the future.

NOTE: Events have been designed here using polymorphic types.
This is a (mostly) untested design pattern for API types, and we are currently learning about its advantages
and disadvantages.
Teams are encouraged to avoid polymorphic types and design their types to use composition instead, if possible.

fields.description: The user who owns this event.

fields.description: The authenticated user's relationship with this event.

fields.description: The stats about engagement with this event.

inputFields.description: Select for events that end after this time.

inputFields.name: endsBefore
inputFields.description: Select for events that end before this time.

inputFields.name: firstPageOptions
inputFields.description:
Defines the strategies that are used to determine where the first page of events should start within the complete
list of events.  Moving forwards or backwards past this first page is possible using standard Relay pagination.
The options are processed in order, and if an option cannot be fulfilled (e.g. if the first option states to
start at a particular ID, but the ID does not exist in the list), then the next option is considered.
If no options can be fulfilled, or no options are given, the first page will start at the first event
after sorting and ordering.

types.name: Milestone
types.description:
Milestone is a construct is used within a tournament. For a given threshold, when the user
cheers at or past this amount, they are able to claim a reward for cheering at this level.
Rewards can be fulfilled by different platforms.
Types of milestones:
- **Global milestone**: for a given threshold, this milestone is reached when cheers from all
  users on the channel is greater than or equal to the threshold.
  This unlocks a reward for all users who have cheered.
- **Individual milestone**: for a given threshold, this milestone is reached when an individual
  user's total cheers in the channel is greater than or equal to the threshold.
  This unlocks a reward for the individual user who cheered.
- **Team milestone**: for a given threshold, this milestone is reached when an individual cheers
  for a specific team in total is greater than or equal to the threshold.
  This unlocks a reward for the individual user who cheered.

NOTE: Should have been named CheeringTournamentMilestone.

fields.description: The user that created this post.

fields.name: body
fields.description: The content of the post as entered by the user and annotated with links and emotes.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Time the post was created by the user.

fields.name: embeds
fields.description: Collection of embedable content attached to this post.

fields.name: id
fields.description: This Post's unique feeds ID.

fields.name: isDeleted
fields.description: Is this post deleted.

fields.name: reactions
fields.description: The reactions associated with this post.

fields.name: self
fields.description: Data related to the current user.

types.name: MessageBody
types.description:
MessageBody is a way of encoding emote annotated text.  The original text is included as content and the
parsed emotes are included which indicate the start and end indexes they should replace.

fields.name: content
fields.description: The text content of the body.

fields.name: emotes
fields.description: Collection of rune indexed emotes to be replaced clientside.

types.name: PostEmbed
types.description: TODO: Add events.

types.name: LinkOEmbed
types.description: LinkOEmbed is a link oEmbed.  This looks strange being empty, but mirrors the oEmbed official spec most exactly.

types.name: OEmbed
types.description: OEmbed is a universal spec converted to GraphQL from http://oembed.com/.

fields.name: inputURL
fields.description:
The inputURL is the URL that we are trying to resolve via oEmbed.  It is not part
of the official spec, but GQL implementations practically need to use it.

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description:
The description of thumbnail from the oembed spec fits with an optional thumbnail
type with required parameters.

fields.name: permissions
fields.description: Permissions that the current user has on this post.

fields.name: canDelete
fields.description: True if the current user is allowed to delete this post.

fields.name: author
fields.description: The user that created this share.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Time the share was created by the user.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Share ID.

fields.name: target
fields.description: The item that was shared.

types.name: FeedItemReason

types.name: FeedItemTracking
types.description: FeedItemTracking contains the tracking info of a feeditem.

types.name: Room
types.description: A chatroom associated with a channel where members of the room can exchange messages.

fields.name: id
fields.description: UUID of the room.

fields.name: isPreviewable
fields.description: Whether the room can be read by non-members and logged out users.

fields.name: members
fields.description: Paginated list of members of the chatroom.

fields.name: messages
fields.description:
List of messages to the room, in reverse chronological order. If fromTime is used, that time is used
as the cursor instead of after/before.

fields.name: minimumAllowedRole
fields.description:
Minimum role required to join the room. For example, in a sub room, subs can join,
but also the broadcaster, mods, and staff.

fields.name: modes
fields.description: Room modes (e.g. slow mode).

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the room (e.g. subs-only).

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user the room belongs to.

fields.name: rolePermissions
fields.description: rolePermissions describes the role necessary to perform actions in the room.

fields.name: self
fields.description: Returns the current user's settings for the room.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The room topic (e.g. "serious discussion only").

types.name: RoomMemberConnection
types.description: Paginated list of room members (users).

fields.name: edges

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information about this page.

types.description: Element in a list of room members.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Opaque cursor describing this edge's position in the paginated list.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The user who is a member of the room.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of user for grouping users in the rooms member list.

types.name: RoomMemberType
types.description: Type of user for grouping users in the rooms member list.

types.name: RoomMessageConnection
types.description: Paginated list of messages in a room.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: The elements of the list.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information about this page.

types.name: RoomMessageEdge
types.description: Element in a list of messages.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Opaque cursor describing this edge's position in the paginated list.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The message.

types.name: RoomMessage
types.description: A message sent from a user to a room.

fields.name: content
fields.description: The text and emoticon content of a message.

fields.name: deletedAt
fields.description: Time the message was deleted or purged. Null if the message is not deleted.

fields.name: id
fields.description: UUID of the message.

fields.name: room
fields.description: The room the message was sent in.

fields.name: sender
fields.description: The user that sent the message.

fields.name: sentAt
fields.description: Time the message was sent.

types.name: RoomRole
types.description:
Describes the role a user must be in order to perform an action, such as sending messages. Roles are
hierarchical, so users that meet a role also meet all lower roles as well. For example, a moderator
meets the subscriber role, even if they are not subscribed to the channel. Roles are defined in order
from highest to lowest in the enum.

enumValues.name: BROADCASTER
enumValues.description: The channel owner.

enumValues.name: MODERATOR
enumValues.description: A moderator for the channel.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIBER
enumValues.description: A subscriber of the channel.

enumValues.name: EVERYONE
enumValues.description: All users.

types.name: RoomModes
types.description: Modes that have been enabled for the room.

fields.name: emotesOnlyModeEnabled
fields.description: If enabled, messages to the room must contain only emotes.

fields.name: r9kModeEnabled
fields.description: If enabled, messages to the room must be unique.

fields.name: slowModeDurationSeconds
fields.description: The number of seconds users must wait between messages. If 0, slow mode is disabled.

types.name: RoomRolePermissions
types.description: RoomRolePermissions describes the role necessary to perform actions in a room.

fields.name: read
fields.description: Read describes the role necessary to read messages in the room.

fields.name: send
fields.description: Send describes the role necessary to send messages in the room.

types.name: RoomView
types.description:
A RoomView represents the authenticated user's self connection to a room, and includes the user's
settings and permissions.

fields.name: isArchived
fields.description: Whether the user has archived the room.

fields.name: isMuted
fields.description: Whether the user has muted the room.

fields.name: isUnread
fields.description: Whether the user has unread messages in the room.

fields.name: lastReadAt
fields.description: Last time the user read a message in the room.

fields.name: permissions
fields.description: The permissions the authenticated user has in the room.

fields.name: room
fields.description: The room the room view belongs to.

fields.name: unreadMentionCount
fields.description: The number of mentions for the user in the room that the user has not read.

types.name: RoomPermissions
types.description: Represents the permissions a user has in a room.

types.name: ChatSettings
types.description: ChatSettings are settings and rules for chatting in a channel.

fields.name: autoModLevel
fields.description:
AutoModLevel is an integer from 0-4 representing the level of automoderation of chat
0 is off, 4 is the highest level of moderation.

fields.name: blockLinks
fields.description: blockLinks indicates if links should be deleted from non-mod messages.

fields.name: chatDelayMs
fields.description: chatDelayMs is the delay before non-mods see a message.

fields.name: followersOnlyDurationMinutes
fields.description:
The number of minutes a user must be following the broadcaster in order to chat
If value is null, followers only mode is not enabled.

fields.name: isBroadcasterLanguageModeEnabled
fields.description:
isBroadcasterLanguageModeEnabled indicates if the broadcaster requires chat messages to
match their language.

fields.name: isFastSubsModeEnabled
fields.description: Indicates whether subscribers are allowed to bypass slowmode.

fields.name: isOptedOutOfGlobalBannedWordsList
fields.description:
If isOptedOutOfGlobalBannedWordsList is true, the legacy twitch banned words list will
be inserted into automod if the channel has automod enabled.

fields.name: isSubscribersOnlyModeEnabled
fields.description: Indicates whether chat is currently restricted to subscribers only.

fields.name: requireVerifiedAccount
fields.description: requireVerifiedAccount indicates if users must be verified to chat.

fields.name: rules
fields.description: rules is a list of rules to display to users when joining a chat channel.

fields.name: slowModeDurationSeconds
fields.description:
The number of seconds a user must wait in between sending chat messages
If value is null, slow mode is not enabled.

types.name: ChatUISettings
types.description: Various user specific settings on how to render chat.

fields.name: isReadableChatColorsEnabled
fields.description: Whether readable chat colors are enabled.

types.name: CheerInfo
types.description: CheerInfo is the channel-specific bits/cheer settings and current state.

fields.name: availableBadges
fields.description: Gets the list of available bits badges the user offers.

fields.name: emotes
fields.description:
emotes are the metadata about the different cheermotes that can be use to cheer in this channel.
This can optionally be filtered to return only certain cheermotes by either prefix and/or emote types.
If `prefixes` is null or empty all available cheermotes will be returned, and then `type` filter
will be applied to the result unless it's null or empty.
If includeUpperTiers is true, the upper tiers of the cheermotes will be returned.

fields.name: hashtags
fields.description:
hashtags for augmenting cheering with different actions, such as #charity will donate bits to
charity, or like #eddie to cheer and support Eddie.

fields.name: leaderboard
fields.description: leaderboard contains the top users by number of bits cheered for the channel.

fields.name: recent
fields.description:
recent is the currently pinned recent cheer.
This feature is deprecated and will always return null.
fields.deprecationReason: Recent cheer is a removed feature, this functionality shouldn't be used anymore.

fields.name: recentTimeoutMs
fields.description:
recentTimeoutMs is the remaining duration the recent message will be pinned for.
This feature is deprecated and will always return 0.
fields.deprecationReason: Recent cheer is a a removed feature, this functionality shouldn't be used anymore.

fields.name: settings
fields.description: settings are the channel-specific cheer settings.

fields.name: top
fields.description:
top is the currently pinned top cheer.
This feature is deprecated and will always returns null.
fields.deprecationReason: Use CheerInfo.leaderboard for current top cheer implementation (contains top 10, instead of single).

types.name: CheermoteType
types.description: CheermoteType is the kind of cheermore (custom vs 1st- or 3rd-party global).

enumValues.name: CUSTOM
enumValues.description: Custom Channel Cheermotes.

enumValues.name: SPONSORED
enumValues.description: Sponsored Cheermotes.

enumValues.name: FIRST_PARTY
enumValues.description: First Party Cheermotes, like Kappa and BibleThump.

enumValues.name: THIRD_PARTY
enumValues.description: Third Party Cheermotes, like Muxy and BitBoss.

enumValues.name: DISPLAY_ONLY
enumValues.description: Cheermotes for display only, and cannot be cheered (such as the sponsored cheermotes when the bits pool is consumed).

enumValues.name: RENDER_ONLY
enumValues.description: Cheermotes that are always hidden from selection / cheering. It does not get displayed.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description:
Unknown cheermote type, we only return this if we get a bad cheermote,
we decided this is better than erroring the whole response, the front end should treat this the same as DISPLAY_ONLY.

types.name: Cheermote
types.description: Cheermote is the metadata about different variations of a single cheermote that can be use to cheer in this channel.

fields.name: campaign
fields.description:
A nullable campaign associated with the cheermote. This would only be attached to
cheermotes that are of the CheermoteType.SPONSORED.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the cheermote.

fields.name: prefix
fields.description:
prefix for this cheering action (Kappa, cheer, Kreygasm, etc).
Any case-insensitive match of this prefix directly followed by a number
(Kappa100, kappa100, kApPa100, etc) is to be considered a cheering message.

fields.name: tiers
fields.description: tiers are bits breakpoints for different images for this cheermote.

fields.name: type
fields.description: type is the kind of cheermote (custom vs 1st- or 3rd-party global).

types.name: CheermoteCampaign
types.description:
A campaign that is in association with a cheermote. Like, Old Spice could have a cheermote with
Terry Crew's head that they will sponsor X Bits that get added on to cheers that use their cheermote.

fields.name: bitsPercentageRemaining
fields.description: The percentage of remaining bits that can be added to cheers.

fields.name: bitsTotal
fields.description: An optional field that shows the user how many bits are being used to sponsor the campaign.

fields.name: bitsUsed
fields.description: An optional field that shows the user how many bits have been used out of the sponsored pool.

fields.name: brandImageURL
fields.description: Image url for the brand image.

fields.name: brandName
fields.description: The name of the brand, used in strings.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The cheermote campaign ID. This is unique.

fields.name: minimumBitsAmount
fields.description: The minimum bits amount to make a cheer add bits from the sponsored campaign.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The nullable edge that relates the user to the campaign.

fields.name: thresholds
fields.description: Thresholds for matching on sponsored cheering.

fields.name: userLimit
fields.description: Amount of bits that an individual user can contribute.

types.name: CheermoteCampaignSelfEdge
types.description: Edge that relates a cheermote campaign to the logged in user.

fields.name: bitsUsed
fields.description: The total bits used by the user in the campaign.

fields.name: canBeSponsored
fields.description: Eligibility for the user to cheer with the sponsored bits in the campaign.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID is comprised of the campaign ID and the user ID.

types.name: CheermoteCampaignThreshold
types.description: Threshold for sponsored cheermote campaign matching.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Id for threshold, generated using the campaign id and the minimum bits field.

fields.name: matchedPercent
fields.description: Percentage for matching.

fields.name: minimumBits
fields.description: Minimum number of bits to get this level of matching.

types.name: CheermoteTier
types.description: CheermoteTier has information about a single tier of a cheermote.

fields.name: bits
fields.description:
bits is the minimum number of bits that are required to render this tier.
To render at this tier the cheemote must have used >= this minimum but < the next smallest tier.

fields.name: canCheer
fields.description: Can this cheer tier be used as a cheermote.

fields.name: canShowInBitsCard
fields.description: Can this cheer tier be shown in the Bits card.

fields.name: color
fields.description: color is the hex color used to render the number of bits for this tier.

fields.name: images
fields.description:
images are urls for the cheermote that match various settings.
This can optionally be filtered to only certain variations or called without arguments to return all available images.

fields.name: tierID
fields.description: tierID of this specific cheermote icon. For "Kappa100" this will be "100".

types.name: ChatTheme
types.description:
ChatTheme is a client-side UI theme.
It can be used to provide different images based on the dominant background color they are designed to display on.

types.name: CheermoteImage
types.description: CheermoteImage is a single image variation of a `CheermoteTier`.

fields.name: dpiScale
fields.description:
dpiScale is the scale of the cheermote image.
Currently available scales are: 1, 1.5, 2, 3, or 4.

fields.name: isAnimated
fields.description: isAnimated is true for animated cheermotes and false otherwise.

fields.name: theme
fields.description: theme is the UI theme the cheermote is designed to be rendered on.

fields.name: url
fields.description: url is the URL of the image asset.

types.name: BitsHashtagConnection
types.description: A list of hashtags to use in chat while using bits.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: The list of BitsHashtagEdges.

types.name: BitsHashtagEdge
types.description: BitsHashtagEdge contains.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: The cursor of the record. This will be the BitsHashtagEdge ID.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The node of the edge contains all information about the hashtag.

types.name: BitsHashtagEntry
types.description: BitsHashtagEntry contains information about a hashtag, sucn as the description and image URL for display.

fields.name: description
fields.description: description text.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID, which would be the hashtag value.

fields.name: imageURL
fields.description: An image to display in autocomplete.

types.name: BitsLeaderboard
types.description: BitsLeaderboard contains the leaderboard for a specified channel.

fields.name: entries
fields.description: entries is the list of users in the leaderboard ordered by the number of bits cheered.
fields.deprecationReason: the ID field is not unique between leaderboards on leaderboard entries. Use leaderboard item.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the id of this leaderboard.

fields.name: items
fields.description: items is the list of users in the leaderboard ordered by the number of bits cheered.

fields.name: secondsRemaining
fields.description: SecondsRemaining is the number of seconds left before the leaderboard expires (or zero for all-time).

types.name: BitsLeaderboardConnection
types.description: Bits leaderboard connection is used to show the various leaderboard entries.

types.description: BitsLeaderboardEdge describes an edge in a bits leaderboard.

fields.name: node

types.name: BitsLeaderboardEntry
types.description: Leaderboard entry at a specific node in a leaderboard connection.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id the id of this leaderboard entry.

fields.name: rank
fields.description: rank the ordinal rank of this leaderboard entry.

fields.name: score
fields.description: score the number of bits cheered by this leaderboard entry.

types.description: Bits leaderboard connection is used to show the various leaderboard items.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: edges ...

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: totalCount ...

types.description: BitsLeaderboardItemEdge describes an edge in a bits leaderboard.

fields.description: The leaderboard entry at this edge.

types.description: Leaderboard item at a specific node in a leaderboard connection.

fields.name: entryKey
fields.description: entryKey the key of this leaderboard item.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id the id of this leaderboard item.

fields.name: rank
fields.description: rank the ordinal rank of this leaderboard item.

fields.name: score
fields.description: score the number of bits cheered by this leaderboard entry.

types.name: ChatMessage
types.description: Cheer is a chat message that uses bits to include cheermotes.

fields.name: author
fields.description: author is the `User` who sent this message.

fields.name: authorColor
fields.description: authorColor is the sender's preferred display name color at the time the message was sent.

fields.name: authorName
fields.description: authorName is the historical value of `author.displayName` at the time the message was sent.

fields.name: badges
fields.description: badges is the list of `Badge` to display on this message.

fields.name: bitsUsed
fields.description: bitsUsed is the number of bits used in this message.

fields.name: body
fields.description: body is the message content and embedded emote info.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: createdAt is the time this message was sent.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is the unique message identifier.

types.name: CheerSettings
types.description: CheerSettings are the channel-specific cheer settings.

fields.name: cheerMinimumBits
fields.description: cheerMinimumBits is the minimum number of bits per message (sum of all cheermotes) required to cheer in this channel.

fields.name: emoteMinimumBits
fields.description: emoteMinimumBits is the smallest number of bits that can be spent on an individual cheermote in this channel.

fields.name: event
fields.description:
event is the name of a special cheering event this channel is currently participating in.
If there is no current event this will return null.

fields.name: isCheerBombEventEnabled
fields.description: Indicates if the bits football cheerbomb event is enabled on the channel.

fields.name: isRecentEnabled
fields.description:
isRecentEnabled indicates if recent cheers are pinned in this channel.
This can be used by a client to update `CheerInfo.recent` as new cheers are received.

fields.name: isTopEnabled
fields.description:
isTopEnabled indicates if top cheers are pinned in this channel.
This can be used by a client to update `CheerInfo.top` as new cheers are received.

fields.name: leaderboard
fields.description: leaderboard contains all of the Bits settings related to Bits Leaderboards for this channel.

fields.name: recentMinimumBits
fields.description: recentMinimumBits is the number of bits required for a cheer to be pinned.

fields.name: recentTimeoutMs
fields.description: recentTimeoutMs is the amount of time a pinned recent message should be displayed for.

types.name: BitsLeaderboardSettings
types.description: BitsLeaderboardSettings are channel-specific settings related to Bits Leaderboards.

fields.name: isEnabled
fields.description: isEnabled indicates if the Bits leaderboard is pinned in this channel.

fields.name: timePeriodType
fields.description: timePeriodType indicates whether the leaderboard type is of WEEKLY, ALL-TIME, etc.

types.name: LeaderboardTimePeriodType
types.description: LeaderboardTimePeriodType enumerates the various types of supported Leaderboards.

enumValues.name: WEEK
enumValues.description: Weekly leaderboards reset at midnight PT between Sunday and Monday.

enumValues.name: MONTH
enumValues.description: Monthly leaderboards reset at midnight PT on the last day of the month.

enumValues.name: ALLTIME
enumValues.description: All time leaderboards are cumulative back to when Bits launched in June of 2016.

types.name: ClientAuthorization
types.description: The authorization a user has provided to an OAuth client.

fields.name: clientID
fields.description: The ID of the client.

fields.name: clientName
fields.description: The name of the client.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time when the authorization was created.

types.name: UserClipsInput
types.description: Filtering criteria for paginated user clips results.

inputFields.name: broadcasterID
inputFields.description: The ID of the broadcaster to filter results by.

inputFields.name: curatorID
inputFields.description: The ID of the curator to filter results by.

inputFields.name: filter
inputFields.description:
DEPRECATED: `filter` should no longer be used. Prefer `period` and `sort` instead.
A filter which restricts results.

inputFields.name: gameName
inputFields.description: The name of the game to filter results by.

inputFields.name: period
inputFields.description: The time period to restrict clips based on creation time.

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description: The sort order for the clips results.

types.name: CollectionsOptions
types.description: A Collections Connection input to set options to include empty collections.

types.name: CollectionsConnection
types.description:
These two types allow clients to query for a LIST of COLLECTIONS
(i.e. a two-dimensional array of videos).

types.name: Collection
types.description: Collection (a.k.a. Playlist) is a backend concept for a list of videos.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The user-supplied description of the collection.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The collection's identifier.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The paginated items in the collection. At this time, they will all be VoDs.

fields.name: lengthSeconds
fields.description: Total length of the collection as summed from all video lengths.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The owner of the collection.

fields.name: thumbnailURL
fields.description:
The thumbnailURL for the collection.
If either `height` or `width` are not given, a templated value (i.e. `{height}`, `{width}`) will be present in the URL instead.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The user-supplied title of the collection.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of collection, either a series or default collection which is ''.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Time when the collection was last updated.

fields.name: viewCount
fields.description: The total view count of a collection.

A page entry, that contains a collection item and a cursor to return

types.name: CollectionItem
types.description: The types of objects that can be contained in a collection.

types.name: CollectionType
types.description: The set of different collection types.

enumValues.name: SERIES

enumValues.name: DEFAULT
enumValues.description: Default collection type.

types.name: FollowedCommunityConnection
types.description: Paginated list of followed communities.

types.name: Community
types.description:
A community is a social structure of Twitch users. Streamers may use them to
reach viewers interested in a specific type of content, and viewers can use them
to discover that content.

fields.name: avatarURL
fields.description:
URL to an avatar image.
The image dimensions are specifiable via the `height` and `width` parameters.

If `height` or `width` are not specified, the URL will contain
the template strings `{height}` and/or `{width}` in their respective places.

fields.name: broadcastersCount
fields.description: Number of broadcasters currently broadcasting in this community.

fields.name: communityType
fields.description:
Communities can have types: "gaming", "creative" or "other" (user-created communities).
When you're sorting through communities, you can filter them by these types, optionally.

fields.name: coverURL
fields.description:
URL to a cover image.
The image dimensions are specifiable via the `height` and `width` parameters.

If `height` or `width` are not specified, the URL will contain
the template strings `{height}` and/or `{width}` in their respective places.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of the community.

fields.name: directoryType
fields.description: The type of directory  in this case, always COMMUNITY.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A publicly visible name used for display purposes.

fields.name: email
fields.description:
An email which serves a contact point for the community. Only the community
owner can see the email.

fields.name: followersCount
fields.description: Number of users that follow this community.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The language that the community's content should be in.

fields.name: name
fields.description: A name for the community.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user who created the community.

fields.name: rules
fields.description: Rules which should be followed to be a part of the community.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The authenticated user's relationship with this Community.

fields.name: streams
fields.description:
Get a page of live streams broadcasting in this community.
If no language filters are provided all languages will be returned.
Tags are an array of tag ID as optional filters for streams.

fields.name: summary
fields.description: A short summary of the community.

fields.name: viewersCount
fields.description: Number of viewers currently watching a stream which is in this community.

types.description: The set of types a Community can have.

enumValues.name: OTHER
enumValues.description: The default type, for user-created communities.

enumValues.name: GAME
enumValues.description: The Community represents a Game.

enumValues.name: CREATIVE
enumValues.description: The Community is a creative Community.

fields.description: The total count of invitations.

types.name: SquadStreamInvitation
types.description:
SquadStreamInvitation represents an invitation sent by a member of a squad stream to another user to
join the squad stream.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the invitation was created.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the invitation.

fields.name: networkType
fields.description: Network type of the invitation. This field is only non nil when the invitation is fetched for User.IncomingSquadStreamInvitations.

fields.name: reasonRejected
fields.description: If the invitation's status is rejected, the reason for the rejection.

fields.name: recipient
fields.description: The user that the invitation is sent to.

fields.name: sender
fields.description: The user that sent the invitation.

fields.name: squadStream
fields.description: The squad stream that the recipient is invited to join.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the invitation.

types.name: SquadStreamInvitationNetworkType
types.description: Describes the network type of a squad stream invitation.

enumValues.name: IN_NETWORK
enumValues.description: The invitation is from within the recipient's network (friends, teammates and followed channels).

enumValues.name: OUT_OF_NETWORK
enumValues.description: The invitation is from outside of the recipient's network.

types.name: SquadStreamInvitationRejectedReason
types.description: Describes the reason a squad stream invitation was rejected.

enumValues.name: RECIPIENT_REJECTED
enumValues.description: The recipient rejected the invitation.

enumValues.name: RECIPIENT_CANNOT_ACCESS_SQUAD_STREAM
enumValues.description: The recipient cannot access the squad stream product (e.g. due to missing transcode, partner-only launch).

enumValues.name: RECIPIENT_CANNOT_BE_INVITED
enumValues.description: The recipient does not allow the sender of the invitation to invite them (e.g. due to their squad stream settings).

types.name: SquadStream
types.description:
A squad stream represents a group of broadcasters that are streaming together.  When a squad
stream is live, viewers can opt to watch the streams of all its members together from a
single view.

Squad streams are created by a broadcaster who invites other broadcasters to participate.
Each broadcaster who accepts an invitation becomes a member of the squad stream and can also
invite other broadcasters to participate.  At the moment, a squad stream can have up to
four members and a broadcaster can only belong to a single squad stream.

A squad stream ends when all its members leave or stop streaming.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the squad stream.

fields.name: invitations
fields.description: The invitations with the given status that have been sent by members to other users to join to squad stream.

fields.name: members
fields.description: Broadcasters who are currently participating in the squad stream.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The owner can remove members from the squad stream.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of the squad stream.

types.name: SquadStreamInvitationStatus
types.description: Describes the current state of a squad stream invitation.

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The recipient has accepted the invitation.

enumValues.name: DELETED
enumValues.description: A squad stream owner has deleted the invitation.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The invitation has been sent to the recipient and the sender is waiting for a response.

enumValues.name: REJECTED
enumValues.description: The recipient has rejected the invitation.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The invitation has an unknown status.

types.name: SquadStreamStatus
types.description: Describes the status of a squad stream.

enumValues.name: LIVE
enumValues.description: The squad stream is live and is being broadcast to viewers.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The squad stream is being set up, and should not be shown to viewers.

enumValues.name: ENDED
enumValues.description: The squad stream has ended.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The squad stream has an unknown status.

types.name: ExtensionInstallation
types.description: Extension Installation are models which contain an Extension and it's associated installation metadata.

fields.name: extension

fields.name: id

fields.name: permittedFeatures
fields.description: The installer's decision whether to allow an extension to use a particular feature.

fields.name: requiredActions
fields.description: The required, if any, for the installed extension after an activation.

fields.description: The self connection of the extension installation.

fields.description:
The anchor that the installation has been activated into. If not activated into a slot,

fields.name: slot
fields.description:
The slot that the installation has been activated into. If not activated into a slot,
the value will be null.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The activation state of the extension installation.

fields.name: x
fields.description:
The horizontal positioning of the left side of the component extension from the left side
of the visible video space as a fixed-point percentage (ie: 5742 would represent 57.42 percent).

fields.name: y
fields.description:
The vertical positioning of the top side of the component extension from the top side
of the visible video space as a fixed-point percentage (ie: 5742 would represent 57.42 percent).

types.name: ExtensionAnchor
types.description: The possible values for an Extension Anchor.

enumValues.name: COMPONENT
enumValues.description: Component extension anchor.

enumValues.name: HIDDEN
enumValues.description: Hidden extensions are used currently for load tests.

enumValues.name: PANEL
enumValues.description: Panel extension anchor.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_OVERLAY
enumValues.description: Video overlay extension anchor.

types.name: ActivationState
types.description: ActivationState contains possible activation states found in the ActivationConfig.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The extension is activated into a slot on the channel.

enumValues.name: INACTIVE
enumValues.description:
The extension has not been activated into a slot or required permsissions/config
is not set up yet.

enumValues.name: REJECTED_PERMISSIONS
enumValues.description: The user rejected the permissions required for the extension to be activated.

types.name: Extension
types.description: Twitch Extension.

fields.description: The SKU of the extension for monetizable extensions.

fields.description: The author of the extension as specified by the developer's extension manifest.

fields.description: The list of categories that the developer has set for the extension.

The description of the extension specified by the developer's extension manifest
(max-length: 1024 characters).

fields.name: hasChatSupport
fields.description: Whether the extension developer has turned on chat support for this extension.

fields.name: hasIdentityLinking
fields.description:
Represents whether or not the developer of the extension would like to provide users with

fields.name: iconURL

fields.deprecationReason: iconURL should be captured from the iconURLs map: Extension.iconURLs.Square100

fields.name: iconURLs
fields.description: The extension icon URLs used to visually represent the extension.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The extension ID which is a composite form of <clientID>:<version>.

fields.name: installationCount
fields.description: The number of installations the extension has.
fields.deprecationReason: Installation counts are no longer surfaced to clients

fields.name: isBitsEnabled

fields.name: privacyPolicyURL

fields.name: screenshotURLs

fields.name: self
fields.description: Represents whether the requesting user is able to install the extension.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: The sku of the extension for monetizable extensions.

fields.name: state

fields.name: summary
fields.description:
The summary of the extension specified by the developer's extension manifest
(max-length: 140 characters).

fields.name: whitelistedPanelURLs

types.name: ExtensionCategorySortKey
types.description: Enumeration of the different sort keys to sort extensions within a category.

enumValues.name: MANUAL
enumValues.description: Manual sort key refers to an arbitrary sorting of extensions.

enumValues.name: POPULARITY
enumValues.description: Popularity sort key refers to sorting of extensions by popularity.

enumValues.name: TIME
enumValues.description: Time sort key refers to sorting of extensions from newest to latest.

types.name: ExtensionCategoryType
types.description: Enumeration of the different category types that are currently supported.

enumValues.name: CURATED
enumValues.description: Curated Category Type is Twitch controlled.

enumValues.name: DEVELOPER
enumValues.description: Developer Category Type is developer controlled.

enumValues.name: PSEUDO
enumValues.description:
Pseudo Categories are categories whose extensions are generated. Slugs are required
on pseudo categories and are often the best way to retrieve them. Example pseudo categories
and slugs include "new-releases" and "whitelisted".

types.name: ExtensionIcons
types.description: The complete set of potential icons provided by a developer to represent their Extension on the site.

fields.name: discoverySplash
fields.description: 300x200 splash image used in extension discovery & management.

fields.name: square100
fields.description: Square 100x100 icon used in extension discovery & management.

fields.name: square24
fields.description: Square 24x24 icon used in video player taskbar.

types.name: ExtensionSelfConnection
types.description: The connection a user has to an Extension object.

fields.name: canInstall
fields.description: Represents whether the requesting user is able to install extensions.

types.name: ExtensionState
types.description: The possible values for ExtensionState.

enumValues.name: IN_TEST
enumValues.description: IN_TEST extensions are currently being worked on by a developer.

enumValues.name: READY_FOR_REVIEW
enumValues.description:
READY_FOR_REVIEW extensions are currently being examined by a developer for their readiness
to be reviewed (assets hosted on CDN).

enumValues.name: IN_REVIEW
enumValues.description: IN_REVIEW extensions are being looked at by Twitch.

enumValues.name: REJECTED
enumValues.description: REJECTED extensions are permanently rejected; no action by the  developer will make them acceptable.

enumValues.name: APPROVED
enumValues.description: APPROVED extensions are ready to be released, at the developer's convenience.

enumValues.name: RELEASED
enumValues.description:
RELEASED extensions are currently available to users.  Only one version of an extension
can be in this state at any time.

enumValues.name: DEPRECATED
enumValues.description: DEPRECATED extensions were once released, but a newer version now exists.

enumValues.name: PENDING_ACTION
enumValues.description: PENDING_ACTION extensions are ones that were reviewed by Twitch and returned to the developer for fixing.

enumValues.name: UPLOADING
enumValues.description: UPLOADING extensions are in the process of having their assets loaded onto S3.

enumValues.name: ASSETS_UPLOADED
enumValues.description:
ASSETS_UPLOADED extensions have had their assets uploaded already to S3. This state mirrors
the existing READY_FOR_REVIEW state, but doesn't incur an implicit upload.

enumValues.name: DELETED
enumValues.description: DELETED extensions have been deleted; this is a soft delete so we can undelete things.

types.name: ExtensionViews
types.description: The potential anchor-specific configurations and extension can have.

fields.name: component
fields.description: The developer configuration of the extension as a component extension, if supported.

fields.name: config

fields.name: hidden
fields.description: The configuration for a hidden extension. The only hidden extension is used for load testing.

fields.name: liveConfig
fields.description: The developer configuration of the extension's live configuration dashboard view, if supported.

fields.name: mobile
fields.description: The developer configuration of the extension as a mobile extension, if supported.

fields.name: panel
fields.description: The developer configuration of the extension as a panel extension, if supported.

fields.name: videoOverlay
fields.description: The developer configuration of the extension as a video overlay extension, if supported.

types.name: ComponentView
types.description: The view configuration of an extension if the component anchor is supported.

fields.name: aspectHeight
fields.description: The developer configured height of the extension as a ratio relative to it's width.

fields.name: aspectWidth
fields.description: The developer configured width of the extension as a ratio relative to it's height.

fields.name: canLinkExternalContent
fields.description: Specifies whether or not the extension has the ability to link to external websites.

fields.name: hasZoom
fields.description:
Specifies whether CSS zooming should be applied to the CE container, creating a consistent
size of 1024 pixels along the long edge of the component. Default: true.

fields.name: size
fields.description:
Size of the long edge of the Component Extension, relative to the length of the corresponding
interactable dimension of the video.

types.name: KeyBatchStatus
types.description: An enumeration of key batch statuses.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The key batch is active and keys generated from it can be claimed.

enumValues.name: INACTIVE
enumValues.description: The key batch is inactive and keys generated from it cannot be claimed.

enumValues.name: INVALIDATED
enumValues.description: The key batch is invalid and keys generated from it are invalidated.

types.name: KeyPoolStatus
types.description: An enumeration of key pool statuses.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The key pool is active and can generate more key batches.

enumValues.name: INACTIVE
enumValues.description: The key pool is inactive and all batches are invalid.

enumValues.name: INVALIDATED
enumValues.description: The key pool is invalid and new batches cannot be made.

types.name: Onboarding
types.description: Current state of the user in the onboarding process.

fields.name: onboardingStreams
fields.description:
Retrieves a list of streams that have been selected for onboarding based on a user's followed games.
`first` is the number of streams PER FOLLOWED GAME to fetch.
`locale` is a language code that will filter streams by if there are viewers with that language code (ex. "en-US", "es-ES", or "de-AT").
`languages` is list of language codes that will be used to filter streams by the broadcaster language. (ex. [EN, KO]).
`games` are a list of game ids that would replace the user's followed games for fetching the streams.

fields.name: skippedChannelIDs
fields.description: List of channel IDs skipped by a user during onboarding.

types.name: PartnershipApplication
types.description: PartnershipApplication is a submitted partnership application.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
ID of the user that submitted the application,
provided purely for the convenience of invalidating GraphQL client caches.

fields.name: resolvedAt
fields.description:
A submitted application currently can only be unresolved or resolved:

- A null resolvedAt timestamp means that the application is unresolved and may be under review.

- A non-null resolvedAt means that the application has been resolved, either approved or rejected.
  A user with an approved application may now start the partnership on-boarding flow.

enumValues.name: AGREEMENT_PENDING_UPGRADE

Whether or not the user is enrolled in the extensions developer program.

fields.name: isSiteAdmin
