types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: BitsAdOffer
types.description: BitsAdOffer is an offer to earn bits by watching an ad or interacting with an engagement.

fields.name: bits
fields.description:
bits is the minimum number of bits received from watching an ad.
Some ads may reward more, but this is the number displayed to the user before choosing to watch an ad for bits.

fields.name: type
fields.description: type is `BitsOfferType.AD`.

types.name: BitsBundleOffer
types.description: BitsBundleOffer is an offer to purchase a number of bits for a certain price.

fields.name: asin
fields.description: asin is the Amazon Standard Identification Number for this offer.

fields.name: bits
fields.description: bits is the number of bits this offer provides.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: Currency code that the price is displayed in (USD, CAD, etc.).

fields.name: discount
fields.description: discount is the bulk discount this offer provides compared to the base offer [0.0-1.0).

fields.name: includesVAT
fields.description:
includesVAT is a boolean flag to indicate that the Value Added Tax (VAT)
is included in the price of a Bits product. This is important for Bits prices 
in EU.

fields.name: isPromo
fields.description:
isPromo is a flag that signifies if the offer is a promotional offer. This is for clients that
need to display promotional offers differently.

fields.name: price
fields.description: price is the formatted currency cost of this offer to be displayed to the user.

fields.name: promotion
fields.description: promotion contains information about this bits offer if it is a promotional offer. Is null if the offer is not promotional.

fields.name: type
fields.description: type is `BitsOfferType.BUNDLE`.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
url is the purchase URL to use for this offer.
The url contains a `{channelID}` token which should be replaced by the `User.id` of the channel bits are being purchased from.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id indicates the particular promo that this offer is associated with.

fields.name: type
fields.description: PromoType indicates the type of promo that the offer represents i.e First time purchase, single purchase, etc...

types.name: BitsKeyCode
types.description: The Bits Key Code that can be claimed to add bits to a user's account.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of what is claimable for the bits key code.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the bits key code.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The field that gives us claim information for the logged in user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type is `ClaimableType.BITS_KEY_CODE`.

types.name: BitsKeyCodeSelfClaimEdge
types.description: User edge relating the key's status to the user.

fields.name: canClaim
fields.description: If the user is eligible to claim the key code.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The user ID that is claiming the code.

fields.name: statusCode
fields.description: Nullable status code for if the user cannot claim the key code.

types.name: DashboardActivityFeedActivityBitsUsage
types.description: When a user uses Bits for or sends Bits to a channel.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Bits spent.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this Bits usage.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: When the Bits were used.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Bits spender.

types.name: DashboardActivityFeedActivityCommunitySubscriptionGifting
types.description: When a user gifts subscriptions to a community for a channel.

fields.name: gifter
fields.description: Subscription purchaser & gifter.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this gifting action.

fields.name: recipients
fields.description:
Users who received the gift.
Maximum count is currently 100.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: When the subscriptions were gifted.

types.name: DashboardActivityFeedActivityFollowing
types.description: When a user newly follows or refollows a channel.

fields.name: follower
fields.description: User who is now following the channel.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this follow action.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: When the user followed the channel.

types.name: DashboardActivityFeedActivityHosting
types.description: When a user hosts a channel.

fields.name: host
fields.description: User/Channel who is now hosting the channel.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this hosting action.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: When the host initiated the hosting session.

fields.name: viewerCount
fields.description: Number of viewers from the host channel.

types.name: DashboardActivityFeedActivityIndividualSubscriptionGifting
types.description: When a user gifts a single subscription to another individual user for a channel.

fields.name: gifter
fields.description: Subscription purchaser & gifter.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this gifting action.

fields.name: recipient
fields.description: User that received the gift.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: When the subscription was gifted.

types.name: DashboardActivityFeedActivityIngestSessionStarting
types.description: When an ingest session begins.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the start of this ingest session.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Start time of the ingest session.

types.name: DashboardActivityFeedActivityPrimeResubscribing
types.description: When a user resubscribes via Twitch Prime to a channel.

fields.name: durationMonths
fields.description: Duration of the subscription.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the act of renewing the subscription.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Custom message submitted by the resubscribing user to share in chat.

fields.name: resubscriber
fields.description: User who is renewing the subscription.

fields.name: timestamp

types.description: When a user subscribes for the first time via Twitch Prime to a channel.

fields.description: Unique identifier for the act of subscribing.

fields.name: subscriber
fields.description: User who made the subscription.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: When the subscription was made.

types.name: DashboardActivityFeedActivityRaiding
types.description: When a user raids a channel.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this raiding action.

fields.name: partySize
fields.description: Number of users who participated in the raid.

fields.name: raider
fields.description: User/Channel who is now raiding the channel.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: When the raid was initiated.

types.name: DashboardActivityFeedActivityResubscribing
types.description: When a user resubscribes (NOT via Twitch Prime) to a channel.

fields.name: durationMonths
fields.description: Duration of the subscription.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the act of renewing the subscription.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Custom message submitted by the resubscribing user to share in chat.

fields.name: resubscriber
fields.description: User who is renewing the subscription.

fields.name: tier
fields.description: Subscription tier.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: When the subscription was renewed.

types.name: SubscriptionTier
types.description:
A channel could have multiple subscription products at varying tiers.
Each value will always map to the respective tier for every channel that has the given tier available as a product.

Example:
A channel with a "tier 2" subscription product will always have the tier represented as T_2000.

enumValues.name: CUSTOM
enumValues.description: Custom tier.

enumValues.name: PRIME
enumValues.description: Subscribed with Twitch Prime.

types.name: DashboardActivityFeedActivitySubscribing
types.description: When a user subscribes for the first time (NOT via Twitch Prime) to a channel.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the act of subscribing.

fields.name: subscriber
fields.description: User who made the subscription.

fields.name: tier
fields.description: Subscription tier.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: When the subscription was made.

types.name: DefaultPanel
types.description: DefaultPanel is the normal panel type that displays text and images.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
description is markdown-formatted text to be displayed below the title and image.
If the panel doesn't have a description this will be null.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is a unique identifier for the panel.

fields.name: imageURL
fields.description:
imageURL is a URL to an image to be displayed at the top of the panel (but below the header).
If the panel doesn't use an image this will be null.

fields.name: linkURL
fields.description:
linkURL is the URL to navigate to when a user clicks on the image.
If the panel's image doesn't link anywhere this will be null.

fields.name: title
fields.description:
title is the header text to display in the panel.
If the panel doesn't have a title this will return null.

fields.name: type
fields.description: type is `PanelType.DEFAULT`.

types.name: DeleteEventInput
types.description: Input for the delete_event mutation.

inputFields.name: eventID
inputFields.description: ID of the event you want to delete.

types.name: DeleteEventPayload
types.description: Payload returned by the delete_event mutation.

fields.name: event
fields.description: The event that was deleted.

types.name: ExtensionPanel
types.description: ExtensionPanel is a placeholder in the panel list for arbitrary iframed content.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is a unique identifier for the panel.

fields.name: slotID
fields.description: slotID is an identifier to map extensions content from `User.extensions` to the proper place in the `User.panels` list.

fields.name: type
fields.description: type is `PanelType.EXTENSION`.

inputFields.name: height
inputFields.description: The height of the image in pixels.

inputFields.name: width
inputFields.description: The width of the image in pixels.

fields.name: game
fields.description: The game being played.

fields.name: type
fields.description: This activity's type, i.e. "PLAYING".

types.name: RejectSquadStreamOutOfNetworkInvitationsError
types.description: RejectSquadStreamOutOfNetworkInvitationsError is the error associated with a rejectSquadStreamOutOfNetworkInvitations.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The associated error code.

types.name: RejectSquadStreamOutOfNetworkInvitationsErrorCode
types.description: RejectSquadStreamOutOfNetworkInvitationsErrorCode are the possible errors that this mutation returns.

enumValues.name: UNAUTHORIZED
enumValues.description: The user is not authorized to reject invitations on behalf of the recipient.

types.name: RejectSquadStreamOutOfNetworkInvitationsInput
types.description: Inputs to the rejectSquadStreamOutOfNetworkInvitations mutation.

inputFields.name: recipientID
inputFields.description: ID of the user whose out of network invitations will be rejected.

types.name: RejectSquadStreamOutOfNetworkInvitationsPayload
types.description: Outputs from the rejectSquadStreamOutOfNetworkInvitations mutation.

fields.name: error
fields.description: The possible error returned from the service.

types.name: SegmentEvent
types.description:
Segment events are sub-events that represent a piece of content that is part of a greater event.
SegmentEvent would be good at representing:
  * A single run of a gaming event like "Awesome Games Done Quick 2017".  These segments could be children
    under a TimetableEvent which would group all the runs for "Awesome Games Done Quick 2018" together.
  * A single panel in a conference like "TwitchCon 2017".  These segments could be children
    under a TimetableEvent which would group all the panels for the conference together.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The channel where this event will be broadcast.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When this event was created.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of this event.

fields.name: endAt
fields.description: The time that this event ends.

fields.name: game
fields.description: The game that will be played during this event.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Event's unique identifier.

fields.name: imageID
fields.description: The chosen image ID for this event.

fields.name: imageURL
fields.description:
The URL or a URL template to the cover image for this event.
An optional width and height can be given to specify the dimension of the image in pixels.
If left unspecified, this field will be a URL template with {width} and {height} placeholders
that the client can replace to create a functional URL.
When width and height are given, this field is a full URL to the image.
The image is first scaled to maintain its aspect ratio, then cropped to fit the given dimensions.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The language that this event is being run in.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user who owns this event.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: The container event that this event is a part of.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The authenticated user's relationship with this event.

fields.name: startAt
fields.description: The time that this event starts.

fields.name: stats
fields.description: The stats about engagement with this event.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of this event.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When this event was last modified.

fields.name: videos
fields.description:
Highlights or past broadcasts recorded during this event.
If a type isn't specified, both broadcasts and highlights will be included in the list.
If sort isn't specified, the list will be sorted by start time, in descending order.

types.name: SegmentParentEvent
types.description:
SegmentParentEvent defines the types of container-events that a SegmentEvent may be a part of.
NOTE: Clients should be resilient to SegmentParentEvent including new types in the future.

types.name: TimetableEvent
types.description:
TimetableEvent describes an event that comprises of a collection of closely related sub-events.
TimetableEvent would be good at representing:
  * A gaming event like "Awesome Games Done Quick 2018" which each run is its own piece of content that can
    be represented by a SegmentEvent
  * A conference like "TwitchCon 2017" where each panel is its own piece of content that can be represented
    by a SegmentEvent.

fields.name: channels
fields.description:
The channels where this event's children will be broadcast.
The channels will be returned in descending order by their associated events' popularity.

fields.name: children
fields.description:
The sub events that make up this Timetable event.
Note that this connection supports both forwards and backwards pagination.  Clients must supply the "first" and
"after" params to page forwards, or "last" and "before" to page backwards.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When this event was created.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of this event.

fields.name: endAt
fields.description: The time that this event ends.

fields.name: games
fields.description:
The games that will be played during this event.
The games will be returned in descending order by their associated events' popularity.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Event's unique identifier.

fields.name: imageID
fields.description: The chosen image ID for this event.

fields.name: imageURL
fields.description:
The URL or a URL template to the cover image for this event.
An optional width and height can be given to specify the dimension of the image in pixels.
If left unspecified, this field will be a URL template with {width} and {height} placeholders
that the client can replace to create a functional URL.
When width and height are given, this field is a full URL to the image.
The image is first scaled to maintain its aspect ratio, then cropped to fit the given dimensions.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The language that this event is being run in.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user who owns this event.

fields.name: self
fields.description: The authenticated user's relationship with this event.

fields.name: startAt
fields.description: The time that this event starts.

fields.name: stats
fields.description: The stats about engagement with this event.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of this event.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: When this event was last modified.

types.name: TimetableChildEventConnection
types.description: Paginated list of sub-events that are part of a TimetableEvent.

types.name: TimetableChildEvent
types.description:
TimetableChildEvent defines the types of sub-events that a TimetableEvent may contain.
NOTE: Clients should be resilient to TimetableChildEvent including new types in the future.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description:
Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion
for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in
[Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
